original: @171a / /rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @171a / /rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: a'arya saddharma smri tyu pa sth'a na /
analyzed: a'arya saddharma smri tyu pa sth'a na /
translated: Ārya-sad-dharma-smṛty-upasthāna

original: bod skad du /🔽'phags pa dam pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa /
analyzed: bod skad du / 'phags pa dam pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa /
translated: In Tibetan:🔽Ārya-dam-pa’i-chos-dran-pa-nye-bar-gzhag-pa

original: bam po dang po /
analyzed: bam po dang po /
translated: Volume One

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / 'phags pa nyan thos thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / 'phags pa nyan thos thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to all the Buddhas, Bodhisattvas, Pratyekabuddhas, and Noble Śrāvakas.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
translated: Thus have I heard at one time.

original: bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na la ti'i grong gi bram ze'i grong na bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na la ti'i grong gi bram ze'i grong na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed One was dwelling in the village of Latī, a brahmin village near Rājagṛha.

original: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu dge slong rab tu mang po dag dang lhan cig tu snga dro'i dus kyi tshe rgyal po'i khab tu bsod snyoms kyi phyir dong ngo //
analyzed: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu dge slong rab tu mang po dag dang lhan cig tu snga dro'i dus kyi tshe rgyal po'i khab tu bsod snyoms kyi phyir dong ngo //
translated: At that time, the venerable Śāradvatīputra, together with many monks, went to Rājagṛha in the morning for alms.

original: de'i tshe dge slong rab tu mang po dag bsod snyoms kyi phyir rgyu ba na gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa kun tu rgyu ba dag @171b ga la ba der dong ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe dge slong rab tu mang po dag bsod snyoms kyi phyir rgyu ba na gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa kun tu rgyu ba dag @171b ga la ba der dong ste /
translated: At that time, many monks were wandering for alms when they went to where the non-Buddhist practitioners were.

original: gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa kun tu rgyu ba dag dang lhan cig tu yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / yang dag par mgu bar 'gyur ba'i chos kyi gtam byas nas gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa kun tu rgyu ba dag gis dris pa /
analyzed: gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa kun tu rgyu ba dag dang lhan cig tu yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / yang dag par mgu bar 'gyur ba'i chos kyi gtam byas nas gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa kun tu rgyu ba dag gis dris pa /
translated: After having a Dharma discussion with the non-Buddhist practitioners that was both delightful and pleasing, the non-Buddhist practitioners asked,

original: kye sh'akya pa dag /
analyzed: kye sh'akya pa dag /
translated: “O Śākya-sons!

original: khyed cag gi dge sbyong goo ta ma lus kyi chad pa mi dge ba mi 'dod pa mi sdug pa yid du mi 'ong ba ston cing /
analyzed: khyed cag gi dge sbyong goo ta ma lus kyi chad pa mi dge ba mi 'dod pa mi sdug pa yid du mi 'ong ba ston cing /
translated: “Is it true that your ascetic Gautama teaches that physical punishments are nonvirtuous, undesirable, and unpleasant,

original: gzhan dag gi la'ang rjes su yid rang bar mi byed pa bden nam /
analyzed: gzhan dag gi la'ang rjes su yid rang bar mi byed pa bden nam /
translated: and that he does not rejoice in others doing them either?”

original: nged cag kyang lus kyi chad pa mi 'dod pa mi sdug pa yid du mi 'ong ba ston cing /
analyzed: nged cag kyang lus kyi chad pa mi 'dod pa mi sdug pa yid du mi 'ong ba ston cing /
translated: “We also teach that physical punishments are undesirable, unpleasant, and unpleasant,

original: gzhan dag gi la'ang rjes su yi rang bar mi byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi la'ang rjes su yi rang bar mi byed do //
translated: We do not rejoice in the faults of others.

original: kye khyed cag gi dge sbyong goo ta ma ngag gi chad pa mi 'dod pa mi sdug pa yid du mi 'ong ba ston cing /
analyzed: kye khyed cag gi dge sbyong goo ta ma ngag gi chad pa mi 'dod pa mi sdug pa yid du mi 'ong ba ston cing /
translated: “Hey, your ascetic Gautama teaches unpleasant, disagreeable, and unappealing speech,

original: gzhan dag gi la'ang rjes su yi rang bar mi byed /
analyzed: gzhan dag gi la'ang rjes su yi rang bar mi byed /
translated: and he does not rejoice in the faults of others.

original: nged cag kyang ngag gi chad pa mi 'dod pa mi sdug pa yid du mi 'ong ba ston cing /
analyzed: nged cag kyang ngag gi chad pa mi 'dod pa mi sdug pa yid du mi 'ong ba ston cing /
translated: We also teach unpleasant, disagreeable, and unappealing speech,

original: gzhan dag gi la'ang rjes su yi rang bar mi byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi la'ang rjes su yi rang bar mi byed do //
translated: and we do not rejoice in the faults of others.

original: khyed cag gi dge sbyong goo ta ma yid kyi chad pa mi 'dod pa yid du mi 'ong ba ston cing /
analyzed: khyed cag gi dge sbyong goo ta ma yid kyi chad pa mi 'dod pa yid du mi 'ong ba ston cing /
translated: “Your ascetic Gautama teaches unpleasant, disagreeable, and unappealing thoughts,

original: gzhan dag gi la'ang rjes su yi rang bar mi byed /
analyzed: gzhan dag gi la'ang rjes su yi rang bar mi byed /
translated: and he does not rejoice in the faults of others.

original: nged kyang yid kyi chad pa mi 'dod pa mi sdug pa yid du mi 'ong ba ston cing /
analyzed: nged kyang yid kyi chad pa mi 'dod pa mi sdug pa yid du mi 'ong ba ston cing /
translated: We also teach unpleasant, disagreeable, and unappealing thoughts,

original: gzhan dag gi la'ang rjes su yi rang bar mi byed na /
analyzed: gzhan dag gi la'ang rjes su yi rang bar mi byed na /
translated: and we do not rejoice in the faults of others.

original: khyed kyi dge sbyong goo ta ma'i chos 'dul ba dang / nged kyi tha dad du bya ba ci yod /
analyzed: khyed kyi dge sbyong goo ta ma'i chos 'dul ba dang / nged kyi tha dad du bya ba ci yod /
translated: “What is the difference between the Dharma and Vinaya of your ascetic Gautama and ours?

original: bsam pa ni ci yod /
analyzed: bsam pa ni ci yod /
translated: What is the difference in our intentions?

original: khyad par ni ci yod /
analyzed: khyad par ni ci yod /
translated: What is the difference in our distinctions?

original: gang gis na dge sbyong goo ta ma'i chos 'dul ba ni nged kyi las khyad par du @172a *//
analyzed: gang gis na dge sbyong goo ta ma'i chos 'dul ba ni nged kyi las khyad par du @172a *//
translated: In what way is the Dharma and Vinaya of the ascetic Gautama superior to ours?

original: 'phags / dge sbyong goo ta ma de ni thams cad mkhyen pa yin no zhes bdag nyid sgrogs /
analyzed: 'phags / dge sbyong goo ta ma de ni thams cad mkhyen pa yin no zhes bdag nyid sgrogs /
translated: The ascetic Gautama proclaims himself to be omniscient.

original: gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa kun tu rgyu ba dag gis de skad dris pa dang / dge slong gsar du rab tu byung ba dag tshe dang ldan pa sha radva ti'i bu dang bral bas rjes su yi rang bar yang mi byed /
analyzed: gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa kun tu rgyu ba dag gis de skad dris pa dang / dge slong gsar du rab tu byung ba dag tshe dang ldan pa sha radva ti'i bu dang bral bas rjes su yi rang bar yang mi byed /
translated: When the tīrthikas, the practitioners, and the parivrājakas asked this, the newly ordained monks, separated from the venerable Śāradvatīputra, did not rejoice

original: lan yang ma btab bo //
analyzed: lan yang ma btab bo //
translated: and did not respond.”

original: de nas dge slong rab tu mang po tshe dang ldan pa sha radva ti'i bu dang bral ba dag bsod snyoms kyi bya ba byas nas na la ti'i grong ga la ba der dong ste phyin nas /
analyzed: de nas dge slong rab tu mang po tshe dang ldan pa sha radva ti'i bu dang bral ba dag bsod snyoms kyi bya ba byas nas na la ti'i grong ga la ba der dong ste phyin nas /
translated: Then the many monks, separated from the venerable Śāradvatīputra, having done their alms round, went to the village of Nālati and arrived there.

original: dge slong rab tu mang po dag zas kyi bya ba byas nas 'khod do //
analyzed: dge slong rab tu mang po dag zas kyi bya ba byas nas 'khod do //
translated: A great many monks had finished their meal and were sitting there.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha radva ti'i bu phyi zhig na bsod snyoms blangs te na la ti'i grong ga la ba der song ngo //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha radva ti'i bu phyi zhig na bsod snyoms blangs te na la ti'i grong ga la ba der song ngo //
translated: Then, on another occasion, the venerable Śāradvatīputra took his alms bowl and went to the village of Nālati.

original: de nas dge slong rab tu mang po tshe dang ldan pa sha radva ti'i bu ga la ba der dong ste phyin nas dge slong rab tu mang po dag gis tshe dang ldan pa sha radva ti'i bu la bsnyad do //
analyzed: de nas dge slong rab tu mang po tshe dang ldan pa sha radva ti'i bu ga la ba der dong ste phyin nas dge slong rab tu mang po dag gis tshe dang ldan pa sha radva ti'i bu la bsnyad do //
translated: Then the many monks went to the venerable Śāradvatīputra, and when they arrived, the many monks said to the venerable Śāradvatīputra,🔽“Venerable Śāradvatīputra, we have finished our meal and are sitting here.🔽Venerable Śāradvatīputra, you should also take your alms bowl and come to the village of Nālati.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha radva ti'i bus dge slong rab tu mang po dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha radva ti'i bus dge slong rab tu mang po dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatīputra said to the many monks,

original: gal te bdag tshe dang ldan pa khyed dang lhan cig rgyal po'i khab kyi lam srang dang / bzhi mdo dang / sum mdo gcig tu rim gyis dong ba las /
analyzed: gal te bdag tshe dang ldan pa khyed dang lhan cig rgyal po'i khab kyi lam srang dang / bzhi mdo dang / sum mdo gcig tu rim gyis dong ba las /
translated: “If I were to go to the village of Nālati with you, venerable ones, along the streets, crossroads, and intersections of Rājagṛha,

original: gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa kun tu rgyu ba rnams dang phrad par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa kun tu rgyu ba rnams dang phrad par gyur na ni /
translated: and were to meet other tīrthika practitioners,

original: des na bdag gis gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa kun tu rgyu ba de dag chos dang mthun pas tshar bcad zin pa zhig na /
analyzed: des na bdag gis gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa kun tu rgyu ba de dag chos dang mthun pas tshar bcad zin pa zhig na /
translated: “I have already defeated those non-Buddhist practitioners and wandering mendicants through the Dharma.

original: kye ma bdag kyang lam srang dang / bzhi mdo dang / @172b sum mdo gzhan nas bsod snyoms la rgyu rgyu nas 'dir phyin te gang tshe dang ldan pa dag gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa kun tu rgyu ba rnams dang lhan cig gtam byas pa'i dri ba'i tshul de ni bdag gis tshor yang ma tshor ro //
analyzed: kye ma bdag kyang lam srang dang / bzhi mdo dang / @172b sum mdo gzhan nas bsod snyoms la rgyu rgyu nas 'dir phyin te gang tshe dang ldan pa dag gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa kun tu rgyu ba rnams dang lhan cig gtam byas pa'i dri ba'i tshul de ni bdag gis tshor yang ma tshor ro //
translated: Alas, I too have been wandering the streets, crossroads, and intersections in search of alms, and I have come here. I have heard and not heard the way you venerable ones have engaged in conversation with the non-Buddhist practitioners and wandering mendicants.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag /🔽bcom ldan 'das kun tu spyan mnga' ba /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag / bcom ldan 'das kun tu spyan mnga' ba /
translated: Venerable ones,🔽the Blessed One is all-seeing,

original: thams cad mngon sum pa /
analyzed: thams cad mngon sum pa /
translated: he is all-knowing,

original: las dang / 'bras bu rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa de ha cang mi ring ba zhig na mu stegs kyi lta ba can thams cad zil gyis mnan nas nyan thos dang / dge bsnyen dang / lha dang / mi rnams la las dang / 'bras bu rnam par smin pa'i chos ston gyi /
analyzed: las dang / 'bras bu rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa de ha cang mi ring ba zhig na mu stegs kyi lta ba can thams cad zil gyis mnan nas nyan thos dang / dge bsnyen dang / lha dang / mi rnams la las dang / 'bras bu rnam par smin pa'i chos ston gyi /
translated: “The one who knows karma and its ripening is not far away. He will overpower all the tīrthikas and teach the Dharma of karma and its ripening to the śrāvakas, the upāsakas, the devas, and humans.

original: khyed de la zhus shig dang / de'ang las dang / rnam par smin pa thams cad ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: khyed de la zhus shig dang / de'ang las dang / rnam par smin pa thams cad ston par mdzad de /
translated: You should ask him, and he will teach you all about karma and its ripening.🔽He will show you what has not been seen

original: gang lha dang bcas pa /
analyzed: gang lha dang bcas pa /
translated: by the devas,

original: bdud dang bcas pa /
analyzed: bdud dang bcas pa /
translated: by Māra,

original: tshangs pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: tshangs pa dang bcas pa /
translated: by Brahmā,

original: dge sbyong dang / bram zer bcas pa'i skye dgu dag gi ma mthong ba de khyed la ston par mdzad cing /
analyzed: dge sbyong dang / bram zer bcas pa'i skye dgu dag gi ma mthong ba de khyed la ston par mdzad cing /
translated: or by the general populace of ascetics and brahmins.🔽He will show you what has not been directly perceived by us.

original: gang bdag cag gi mngon sum du ma gyur pa de'ang khyod la bcom ldan 'das shin tu mngon sum du gyur pa /
analyzed: gang bdag cag gi mngon sum du ma gyur pa de'ang khyod la bcom ldan 'das shin tu mngon sum du gyur pa /
translated: The Blessed One, who has direct perception,

original: las dang / 'bras bu rnam par smin pa mkhyen par mdzad do //
analyzed: las dang / 'bras bu rnam par smin pa mkhyen par mdzad do //
translated: knows karma and its ripening.”

original: de nas dge slong rab tu mang po dag bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ngo //
analyzed: de nas dge slong rab tu mang po dag bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ngo //
translated: Then a great many monks went to where the Blessed One was.

original: de nas dge slong de dag gi bcom ldan 'das nyin mo'i gnas pas bzhugs pas /
analyzed: de nas dge slong de dag gi bcom ldan 'das nyin mo'i gnas pas bzhugs pas /
translated: Then, as the Blessed One was sitting in his daytime quarters,

original: ri rab ltar rang gi 'od kyi dra bas mngon par 'bar ba /
analyzed: ri rab ltar rang gi 'od kyi dra bas mngon par 'bar ba /
translated: he was shining with his own light, like Mount Meru.

original: nyin mo'i nyi ma ltar snang bas rab tu gsal ba /
analyzed: nyin mo'i nyi ma ltar snang bas rab tu gsal ba /
translated: He was radiant with light, like the sun in the daytime.

original: mtshan mo'i zla ba ltar zhi bas rab tu sim par mdzad pa /🔽mtsho ltar shin @173a *//
analyzed: mtshan mo'i zla ba ltar zhi bas rab tu sim par mdzad pa / mtsho ltar shin @173a *//
translated: He was soothing with peace, like the moon at night.

original: tu gsal ba /
analyzed: tu gsal ba /
translated: He was very clear, like a lake.

original: rgya mtsho ltar zab pa /
analyzed: rgya mtsho ltar zab pa /
translated: He was deep, like the ocean.

original: ri rab ltar mi g-yo ba /
analyzed: ri rab ltar mi g-yo ba /
translated: He was unmoving, like Mount Meru.

original: seng ge ltar dpa' ba /
analyzed: seng ge ltar dpa' ba /
translated: He was heroic, like a lion.

original: pha ma ltar 'byung po thams cad kyi skyabs su gyur pa thugs rje chen pos brlan pa'i thugs sems can thams cad kyi gnyen gcig par gyur pa /
analyzed: pha ma ltar 'byung po thams cad kyi skyabs su gyur pa thugs rje chen pos brlan pa'i thugs sems can thams cad kyi gnyen gcig par gyur pa /
translated: He was the refuge of all beings, like a father and mother. His mind was moistened with great compassion, and he was the sole kinsman of all sentient beings.

original: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms kyi rten du gyur pa /
analyzed: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms kyi rten du gyur pa /
translated: He was the support of love, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos chen po sum cu rtsa bdun gyis sku brgyan pa /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos chen po sum cu rtsa bdun gyis sku brgyan pa /
translated: His body was adorned with the thirty-seven factors of awakening.

original: rab tu dang bas lus can thams cad kyi mig mgu bar mdzad pa /
analyzed: rab tu dang bas lus can thams cad kyi mig mgu bar mdzad pa /
translated: He delighted the eyes of all beings with his radiance.

original: zla ba dang / nyi ma'i 'od zil gyis gnon pa /
analyzed: zla ba dang / nyi ma'i 'od zil gyis gnon pa /
translated: He outshone the light of the sun and moon.

original: sh'a kya'i rgyal po'i sras kun tu spyan mnga' ba /
analyzed: sh'a kya'i rgyal po'i sras kun tu spyan mnga' ba /
translated: He was the son of the king of the Śākyas.

original: spyan dri ma gsum dang bral ba /
analyzed: spyan dri ma gsum dang bral ba /
translated: His eyes were free from the three stains.

original: bden pa gnyis gsung ba /
analyzed: bden pa gnyis gsung ba /
translated: He taught the two truths.

original: sdug bsngal gnyis mkhyen pa /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gnyis mkhyen pa /
translated: He knew the two kinds of suffering.🔽He had realized the two meditations.

original: bsgom pa gnyis bsgoms shing mngon sum du mdzad pa; lam gyi 'bras bu mngon du mdzad pa /
analyzed: bsgom pa gnyis bsgoms shing mngon sum du mdzad pa; lam gyi 'bras bu mngon du mdzad pa /
translated: He was the one who had realized the result of the path.

original: 'gog pa'i de nyid mkhyen pa /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i de nyid mkhyen pa /
translated: He knew the suchness of cessation.

original: khams gsum mngon sum du mdzad pa'i spyan mnga' ba /
analyzed: khams gsum mngon sum du mdzad pa'i spyan mnga' ba /
translated: He had eyes that directly perceived the three realms.🔽He was the one who taught the three realms.

original: khams gsum gzhan yang dag par ston pa; khams bco brgyad kyi de nyid mkhyen pa /
analyzed: khams gsum gzhan yang dag par ston pa; khams bco brgyad kyi de nyid mkhyen pa /
translated: He knew the suchness of the eighteen elements.

original: mos pa yid la byed pa'i de nyid mkhyen pa /
analyzed: mos pa yid la byed pa'i de nyid mkhyen pa /
translated: He knew the suchness of the mental activity of interest.

original: yon tan gyi klung rang gi yon tan bco brgyad dag dang ldan pa /
analyzed: yon tan gyi klung rang gi yon tan bco brgyad dag dang ldan pa /
translated: He was the one who had the eighteen unique qualities of a buddha.

original: srid pa'i 'ching ba las rnam par grol ba /
analyzed: srid pa'i 'ching ba las rnam par grol ba /
translated: He was liberated from the bonds of existence.

original: stobs bcu dang ldan pa /
analyzed: stobs bcu dang ldan pa /
translated: He possessed the ten powers.

original: bsnyengs pa mi mnga' ba bzhis mi bsnyengs pa /
analyzed: bsnyengs pa mi mnga' ba bzhis mi bsnyengs pa /
translated: He was fearless with the fourfold fearlessness.

original: thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa /
analyzed: thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa /
translated: He possessed great compassion.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum dang rtag tu ldan pa @173b de mthong ngo //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum dang rtag tu ldan pa @173b de mthong ngo //
translated: He was always endowed with the three establishments of mindfulness.

original: de nas dge slong rab tu mang po dag chos gos phrag pa gcig la gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te /
analyzed: de nas dge slong rab tu mang po dag chos gos phrag pa gcig la gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te /
translated: Then the many monks, having draped their robes over one shoulder, knelt on their right knees,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal nas dul bas mgo btud de phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal nas dul bas mgo btud de phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
translated: bowed their heads to the feet of the Blessed One, and sat to one side with subdued heads.

original: de nas dge slong rab tu mang po dag gis dge slong gcig cig bsgo ba dang / bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der shin tu nye bar phyin nas /
analyzed: de nas dge slong rab tu mang po dag gis dge slong gcig cig bsgo ba dang / bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der shin tu nye bar phyin nas /
translated: Then the many monks instructed a certain monk, who approached the Blessed One,

original: yang de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: yang de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: and having approached, bowed his head to the feet of the Blessed One, and said this to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One!

original: 'dir bdag snga dro'i dus su lhung bzed dang / chos gos 'tshal nas rgyal po'i khab tu bsod snyoms la mchi mchi na zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: 'dir bdag snga dro'i dus su lhung bzed dang / chos gos 'tshal nas rgyal po'i khab tu bsod snyoms la mchi mchi na zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin te /
translated: “Here, in the morning, I put on my robes and, carrying my alms bowl, I went to Rājagṛha for alms.

original: gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa kun tu rgyu ba rnams dang lhan cig lus kyi chad pa dang / ngag gi chad pa dang / yid kyi chad pa sngon du 'gro ba'i gtam 'dri ba'i bar snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa kun tu rgyu ba rnams dang lhan cig lus kyi chad pa dang / ngag gi chad pa dang / yid kyi chad pa sngon du 'gro ba'i gtam 'dri ba'i bar snga ma bzhin te /
translated: As before, I had a conversation with the tīrthikas, the naked ascetics, and the wandering mendicants, asking about the physical, verbal, and mental faults.

original: de dag bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: de dag bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: They then asked the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe dge slong de dag dang / na la ti'i grong gi bram ze la sogs pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //

translated: giving medicine to a sick person with the intention of helping, but causing his death;🔽beating a child in order to discipline him, but causing his death; and causing a living being to fall into a fire without intending to kill it.

original: gos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gos par mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: bdag nyid la bdag nyid slu zhing gzhan yang slu ba yin te / smras pa'i tshe rgyal po'am /
translated: It is deceiving oneself and deceiving others.🔽When one speaks, one deceives the king,

original: blon po / mngon sum du gzhan dag la gnod pa dam /
analyzed: blon po / mngon sum du gzhan dag la gnod pa dam /
translated: or the king’s ministers, or others in the presence of the king.

original: 'phrog par byed pa log pas bskyed pa'i rdzun gyi skyon rab tu 'jug pa 'di ni brdzun du smra ba ngag gi chad pa rdzogs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'phrog par byed pa log pas bskyed pa'i rdzun gyi skyon rab tu 'jug pa 'di ni brdzun du smra ba ngag gi chad pa rdzogs pa yin te /
translated: This is the completion of the verbal transgression of lying.

original: sems can dmyal dmyong bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: sems can dmyal dmyong bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The result of lying is to experience hell.

original: gzhan yang / ngag gi chad pa phra ma zhes bya ba ni don gcig la mthun par zhugs pa rnams la dbyen bya ba'i bsam pas tshig rjod par byed pa 'di ni phra ma'i ngag gi chad pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang / ngag gi chad pa phra ma zhes bya ba ni don gcig la mthun par zhugs pa rnams la dbyen bya ba'i bsam pas tshig rjod par byed pa 'di ni phra ma'i ngag gi chad pa yin no //
translated: The verbal transgression called slander is to speak words with the intention of creating disharmony among those who are in agreement.

original: phra ma'i 'bras bu chung ba ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: phra ma'i 'bras bu chung ba ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is the small result of slander?

original: bdag gti mug gis ngan pa byas so zhes 'chags par byed /
analyzed: bdag gti mug gis ngan pa byas so zhes 'chags par byed /
translated: One confesses one’s own evil deeds out of delusion.

original: gzhan phra ma la mngon par dga' ba zlog par byed /
analyzed: gzhan phra ma la mngon par dga' ba zlog par byed /
translated: One turns others away from delighting in slander.

original: lam la yang dag par 'jog par byed /
analyzed: lam la yang dag par 'jog par byed /
translated: One establishes others on the path.

original: yang las kyi nyer bsdogs dang / las kyi mjug mi byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yang las kyi nyer bsdogs dang / las kyi mjug mi byed pa yin no //
translated: One does not perform the preparatory action for a misdeed or the concluding action of a misdeed.

original: las kyi nyer bsngogs ji na //
analyzed: las kyi nyer bsngogs ji na //
translated: What is the preparatory action for a misdeed?

original: phra ma'i las kyi lam dang yang dag par rab tu ba nyon mongs pa rgyags pa la mngon par zhugs pa'i tshig gzhan du brtags nas gzhan la smra ba 'di ni las kyi nyer bsngogs yin na //
analyzed: phra ma'i las kyi lam dang yang dag par rab tu ba nyon mongs pa rgyags pa la mngon par zhugs pa'i tshig gzhan du brtags nas gzhan la smra ba 'di ni las kyi nyer bsngogs yin na //
translated: The proximate action is the words that are used to divide others, which are spoken with a mind that is afflicted by the mental factor of agitation.

original: phra ma'i las kyi lam dang yang dag par rab tu ldan pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: phra ma'i las kyi lam dang yang dag par rab tu ldan pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is the actual basis of the action?

original: 'di la sdang ba'i sems kyis yang dang / yang du gzhan 'byed la rjes su yi rang bzhing kun dga' bar byed pa 'di ni phra ma'i las kyi lam dang yang dag par ldan @177a *//🔽pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la sdang ba'i sems kyis yang dang / yang du gzhan 'byed la rjes su yi rang bzhing kun dga' bar byed pa 'di ni phra ma'i las kyi lam dang yang dag par ldan @177a *// pa yin no //
translated: The actual basis of the action is the delight and satisfaction that one feels when one has divided others and when one rejoices in the division of others.

original: las kyi mjug dang bcas pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /🔽'di la phra ma byas nas rjes su yi rang bar byed /
analyzed: las kyi mjug dang bcas pa ji lta bu yin zhe na / 'di la phra ma byas nas rjes su yi rang bar byed /
translated: What is the conclusion of the action?🔽The conclusion of the action is the delight and satisfaction that one feels when one has divided others and when one rejoices in the division of others.🔽What is the action that is done?

original: phyir zhing byed byed pa la rjes su yi rang bar byed; yid kyis kun tu rtog par byed /🔽de nyid la mngon par dga' bar byed /
analyzed: phyir zhing byed byed pa la rjes su yi rang bar byed; yid kyis kun tu rtog par byed / de nyid la mngon par dga' bar byed /
translated: The action that is done is the delight and satisfaction that one feels when one has divided others and when one rejoices in the division of others.

original: ngang tshul gzhan du mi byed pa yin /
analyzed: ngang tshul gzhan du mi byed pa yin /
translated: What is the action that is carried out?🔽The action that is carried out is the delight and satisfaction that one feels when one has divided others and when one rejoices in the division of others.🔽What is the action that is done and carried out?🔽The action that is done and carried out is the delight and satisfaction that one feels when one has divided others and when one rejoices in the division of others.

original: sdang ba'i sems yin /
analyzed: sdang ba'i sems yin /
translated: It is a hostile attitude.

original: gzhan dag gis btsal cing yid ches pa'i gnas su mi 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis btsal cing yid ches pa'i gnas su mi 'gyur ba yin /
translated: It is not a basis for others to seek and trust.

original: smod pa yin /
analyzed: smod pa yin /
translated: It is disparaging.

original: ngo tsha bar mi byed cing khrel med la bdag nyid la smod par mi byed pa 'di ni phra ma'i chad pa yin no //
analyzed: ngo tsha bar mi byed cing khrel med la bdag nyid la smod par mi byed pa 'di ni phra ma'i chad pa yin no //
translated: It is not ashamed and has no sense of decency. It is not self-deprecating. This is the penalty for divisive speech.

original: gzhan yang / tshig rtsub po'i chad pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang / tshig rtsub po'i chad pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: “What is the penalty for harsh speech?

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa chos dang / las dang / kun 'byung ba mthong ba des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas mthong ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa chos dang / las dang / kun 'byung ba mthong ba des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas mthong ste /
translated: A spiritual practitioner who sees the Dharma, karma, and origination with insight sees this with knowledge derived from hearing.

original: 'di ni tshig rtsub pos bdag gdung bar byed cing yid du mi 'ong ba rna bar thos la glags skyed par byed /
analyzed: 'di ni tshig rtsub pos bdag gdung bar byed cing yid du mi 'ong ba rna bar thos la glags skyed par byed /
translated: Harsh speech torments oneself and is unpleasant to hear. It creates opportunities for regret.

original: de gzhan la gnas te mkhyud pa dang / 'chags pa dang / dgod pa dang / khro ba'i bsam pas rnam par smin pa du ma rnam pa du ma'o //
analyzed: de gzhan la gnas te mkhyud pa dang / 'chags pa dang / dgod pa dang / khro ba'i bsam pas rnam par smin pa du ma rnam pa du ma'o //
translated: When it is directed at others, it is a cause for many different kinds of ripening, such as embracing, confessing, laughing, and angry thoughts.

original: de la tshig rtsub po chen pos ni sems can dmyal ba'i tshor ba myong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de la tshig rtsub po chen pos ni sems can dmyal ba'i tshor ba myong bar 'gyur /
translated: With very harsh speech, one experiences the feelings of a hell being.

original: tshig rtsub po 'chags pa ni myong bar 'gyur bar ma nges pa yin te 'di dag ni ngag gi chad pa gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig rtsub po 'chags pa ni myong bar 'gyur bar ma nges pa yin te 'di dag ni ngag gi chad pa gsum pa yin no //
translated: The confession of harsh speech is not necessarily experienced, and this is the third verbal fault.

original: las kyi nyer bsdogs dang / las kyi mjug dang / yang dag par ldan pa zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: las kyi nyer bsdogs dang / las kyi mjug dang / yang dag par ldan pa zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The preparatory stage of the action, the conclusion of the action, and the connection are as before.

original: gzhan yang / ngag gi chad pa bzhi pa ji lta bu yin @177b zhe na; rnal 'byor spyod pa las dang chos dang / rnam par smin pa'i rnam pa du ma shes pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang / ngag gi chad pa bzhi pa ji lta bu yin @177b zhe na; rnal 'byor spyod pa las dang chos dang / rnam par smin pa'i rnam pa du ma shes pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, what is the fourth verbal fault? The spiritual practitioner who has knowledge of the various kinds of action, phenomena, and ripening knows that idle talk is a verbal fault.

original: tshig khyal pa zhes bya ba snga phyi 'brel pa med pa'i tshig kyal pa snga ma dang phyi mar mi sbyor ba yin te /
analyzed: tshig khyal pa zhes bya ba snga phyi 'brel pa med pa'i tshig kyal pa snga ma dang phyi mar mi sbyor ba yin te /
translated: Idle talk is speech that is not connected to what was said before or after, and it is not connected to what was said before or after.

original: myong bar 'gyur bar ma nges shing kha na ma tho ba mi mang ba yin pa 'di ni ngag gi chad pa bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: myong bar 'gyur bar ma nges shing kha na ma tho ba mi mang ba yin pa 'di ni ngag gi chad pa bzhi pa yin no //
translated: The confession of idle talk is not necessarily experienced, and it is not a great offense. This is the fourth verbal fault.

original: gzhan yang / yid kyi chad pa ji lta bu yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang / yid kyi chad pa ji lta bu yin /
translated: Moreover, what is a mental fault?

original: rnam pa ni du zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: rnam pa ni du zhig yod ce na /
translated: How many types are there?

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa las dang / chos dang / rnam par smin pa la rjes su lta ba des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas yid kyi chad pa rnam pa gsum mthong ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa las dang / chos dang / rnam par smin pa la rjes su lta ba des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas yid kyi chad pa rnam pa gsum mthong ste /
translated: The yogis and yoginis who are observing action, phenomena, and ripening see three types of mental downfalls through the knowledge derived from hearing.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: brnab sems ni gzhan gyi 'byor pa mthong nas shin tu rtog par byed /🔽sems kyis 'dod par byed /
analyzed: brnab sems ni gzhan gyi 'byor pa mthong nas shin tu rtog par byed / sems kyis 'dod par byed /
translated: Covetousness is the intense desire for the wealth of others that arises when you see it.

original: rdzas 'di ni bdag gir bya'o snyam ste /
analyzed: rdzas 'di ni bdag gir bya'o snyam ste /
translated: You think, “I want that wealth to be mine.”

original: brnab sems 'di ni yid kyi chad pa dang po yin no //
analyzed: brnab sems 'di ni yid kyi chad pa dang po yin no //
translated: This is the first mental downfall.

original: gzhan yang / yid kyi chad par 'gyur ba ni pha rol gyi phun sum tshogs pa mthong nas yid rab tu sdang ba gnod sems te /
analyzed: gzhan yang / yid kyi chad par 'gyur ba ni pha rol gyi phun sum tshogs pa mthong nas yid rab tu sdang ba gnod sems te /
translated: The second mental downfall is malice, which is the intense hatred that arises when you see the good fortune of others.

original: yid kyi chad pa gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi chad pa gnyis pa yin no //
translated: This is the second mental downfall.

original: gzhan yang / yid kyi chad pa gsum pa ni log par lta bas phyin ci log tu mthong ba log par lta ba'i chad pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang / yid kyi chad pa gsum pa ni log par lta bas phyin ci log tu mthong ba log par lta ba'i chad pa'o //
translated: The third mental downfall is the downfall of wrong views, which is the distorted perception that arises from wrong views.

original: de'ang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de'ang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of wrong views:

original: yod pa 'jig pa dang / log par shes pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa 'jig pa dang / log par shes pa'o //
translated: the view that what exists is nonexistent and the view that what does not exist does exist.

original: de la yod pa 'jig pa ni /
analyzed: de la yod pa 'jig pa ni /
translated: The annihilation of what exists is as follows:

original: 'di ltar sbyin pa med /
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyin pa med /
translated: “There is no giving,

original: sbyin sreg med /
analyzed: sbyin sreg med /
translated: no sacrifice,

original: mchod sbyin med /
analyzed: mchod sbyin med /
translated: no offering,

original: legs par byas pa dang / nyes par byas pa dag gi las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do zhes bya ba rgya cher sbyor ro //
analyzed: legs par byas pa dang / nyes par byas pa dag gi las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do zhes bya ba rgya cher sbyor ro //
translated: and there are no good or bad actions whose results fully ripen.”

original: log par @178a *//🔽shes pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: log par @178a *// shes pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Wrong view is

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gang yin pa de ni lhas byas kyi /
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gang yin pa de ni lhas byas kyi /
translated: “Whatever is happiness or suffering is created by God.

original: las kyi 'bras bus ni ma byas so zhes zer ba ste /
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bus ni ma byas so zhes zer ba ste /
translated: It is not created by action and its results.”

original: 'di ni log par lta ba rnam pa gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni log par lta ba rnam pa gnyis pa yin no //
translated: This is the second form of wrong view.

original: gzhan yang / ji ltar na lus dang / ngag dang / yid rnam pa gsum gyi chad pa rnam pa bcu kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas na tshe 'di nyid la las kyi 'bras bu myong bar 'gyur bar nges pa dang / shi nas gzhan du skyes na de'i rgyu can gyi las kyi 'bras bu gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang / ji ltar na lus dang / ngag dang / yid rnam pa gsum gyi chad pa rnam pa bcu kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas na tshe 'di nyid la las kyi 'bras bu myong bar 'gyur bar nges pa dang / shi nas gzhan du skyes na de'i rgyu can gyi las kyi 'bras bu gang yin pa dang /
translated: Moreover, how is it that the ten kinds of punishment for the three kinds of actions of body, speech, and mind, when practiced, cultivated, and repeated a great deal, are certain to be experienced in this very life, and how is it that, when one dies and is reborn elsewhere, the results of the actions that are their causes are experienced there?

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ji lta bu yin pa dang / yang 'jig rten 'dir skyes na'ang de dag ci 'dra bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ji lta bu yin pa dang / yang 'jig rten 'dir skyes na'ang de dag ci 'dra bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: And if they are born in this world, what are they like?

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa las dang / chos dang / rnam par smin pa la rjes su lta ba des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa'am lha'i mig gis mthong ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa las dang / chos dang / rnam par smin pa la rjes su lta ba des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa'am lha'i mig gis mthong ste /
translated: The yogis and yoginis who observe the Dharma and its results see with knowledge derived from hearing or with the divine eye:

original: lus kyi srog gcod pa dang po'o //
analyzed: lus kyi srog gcod pa dang po'o //
translated: Killing is the first.

original: srog gcod pa kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags kyi yul rnams su skye bar byed do //
analyzed: srog gcod pa kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags kyi yul rnams su skye bar byed do //
translated: Killing is the cause for birth as a hell being, an animal, or a ghost.

original: gal te mi dag dang skal ba mnyam par mi'i nang du skyes na de tshe thung ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te mi dag dang skal ba mnyam par mi'i nang du skyes na de tshe thung ba yin no //
translated: If one is born with the general lot in life of a human, one will have a short life.

original: gal te rngon pa lta bu la chags pas srog gcod pa byas na /
analyzed: gal te rngon pa lta bu la chags pas srog gcod pa byas na /
translated: If one kills out of attachment to hunting,

original: srog gcod pa byas de nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: srog gcod pa byas de nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: one’s killing will be wasted.

original: de ri dvags dang / phag dang / sreg pa dang / khyim bya dang / gong ma sreg dang / nya la sogs par gyur pa na /
analyzed: de ri dvags dang / phag dang / sreg pa dang / khyim bya dang / gong ma sreg dang / nya la sogs par gyur pa na /
translated: When they are born as deer, pigs, chickens, sheep, or fish,

original: rgya'am / mchil pas gsod do //
analyzed: rgya'am / mchil pas gsod do //
translated: they are killed by traps, snares, or nets.

original: 'khor ba na las de lta bu'i rgyus 'brel pa @178b gal te'ang mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par mi'i nang du skyes na de tshe thung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'khor ba na las de lta bu'i rgyus 'brel pa @178b gal te'ang mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par mi'i nang du skyes na de tshe thung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: “If, due to the connection with such actions in cyclic existence, they are born with the general lot in life of a human, they will have a short life.

original: mkhas pa rnams kyi yul du skye bar mi 'gyur la mtshon mang pos 'khrug pa'i yul du myur ba nyid du gsod do //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyi yul du skye bar mi 'gyur la mtshon mang pos 'khrug pa'i yul du myur ba nyid du gsod do //
translated: They will be born in a place where there are many learned people, and they will be quickly killed in a place where there is much warfare.

original: srog gcod pa chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: srog gcod pa chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: There are three types of killing: killing that is slight, killing that is moderate, and killing that is great.

original: kha cig mngal dang de bzhin gzhan //
analyzed: kha cig mngal dang de bzhin gzhan //
translated: Some die in the womb, and others are born there.

original: btsas pa'i khyim dang gzhan dag ni //🔽gog pa tsam dang de bzhin du //
analyzed: btsas pa'i khyim dang gzhan dag ni // gog pa tsam dang de bzhin du //
translated: Some die in the house, and others🔽crawl about.

original: gzhan dag yongs su rgyug na 'chi //
analyzed: gzhan dag yongs su rgyug na 'chi //
translated: Some die while running about, and others die when they are old.

original: de ltar srog gcod pa ni da ltar gyi tshe la rnam par smin pas dbang du byas pa'i las yin no //
analyzed: de ltar srog gcod pa ni da ltar gyi tshe la rnam par smin pas dbang du byas pa'i las yin no //
translated: Thus, killing is an action that is governed by the results that occur in the present life.

original: gzhan yang / ma byin par len pa kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pa'i rnam par smin pa rnam pa gsum po /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang / ma byin par len pa kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pa'i rnam par smin pa rnam pa gsum po / 'di lta ste /
translated: Furthermore,🔽the three types of karmic ripening that result from frequently engaging in, becoming habituated to, and increasing acts of stealing are as follows.

original: sems can dmyal ba myong ba dang / tshe 'di dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba myong ba dang / tshe 'di dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What are the three types of karmic ripening?

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa las dang / chos dang / rnam par smin pa la rjes su lta ba des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas mthong ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa las dang / chos dang / rnam par smin pa la rjes su lta ba des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas mthong ste /
translated: The practitioner who observes phenomena and their ripening will see this with knowledge derived from hearing.

original: de la ma byin par len pa kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang; yi dvags rnams kyi yul du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la ma byin par len pa kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang; yi dvags rnams kyi yul du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this regard, by frequently engaging in, becoming habituated to, and increasing acts of stealing, one will be born in the realms of hell beings, animals, and hungry ghosts.

original: gal te mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par mi'i nang du skyes na'ang dbul bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par mi'i nang du skyes na'ang dbul bar 'gyur te /
translated: If one is born among humans, who share in the same type of existence, one will be poor.

original: longs spyod bsgrubs pa gang dag yod pa de dag rgyal po'i chad pa dang / chu dang / me dang / mtshon dang / chom rkun gyi 'jigs pa dag gis bsags bsags pa dag la chud za bar 'gyur /
analyzed: longs spyod bsgrubs pa gang dag yod pa de dag rgyal po'i chad pa dang / chu dang / me dang / mtshon dang / chom rkun gyi 'jigs pa dag gis bsags bsags pa dag la chud za bar 'gyur /
translated: Whatever wealth he has acquired through his efforts is lost through the king’s punishment, water, fire, weapons, and thieves.

original: nam yang bde bar mi 'gyur te /🔽'di ni ma byin @179a *//
analyzed: nam yang bde bar mi 'gyur te / 'di ni ma byin @179a *//
translated: He never has any happiness.

original: par len pa'i chad pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: par len pa'i chad pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa gsum pa yin no //
translated: This is the third kind of result of stealing, the result that is experienced in this life.

original: gzhan yang / nang gi 'dod pas log par g-yem pa kun tu bstan cing bsgoms te mang du byas pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa gsum pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /🔽rnal 'byor spyod pa las dang / chos dang / rnam par smin pa la rjes su lta ba des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang / nang gi 'dod pas log par g-yem pa kun tu bstan cing bsgoms te mang du byas pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa gsum pa ji lta bu yin zhe na / rnal 'byor spyod pa las dang / chos dang / rnam par smin pa la rjes su lta ba des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa'am /
translated: “What is the third kind of result of sexual misconduct, experienced in this life?

original: lha'i mig gis mthong ste /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong ste /
translated: The spiritual practitioner who observes the internal body, who observes the Dharma, and who observes the results of ripening sees by means of knowledge derived from hearing or through the divine eye.🔽He sees that when sexual misconduct is revealed, cultivated, and increased, there are three kinds of results.

original: 'dod pas log par g-yem pa kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags rnams kyi yul du skye'o //
analyzed: 'dod pas log par g-yem pa kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags rnams kyi yul du skye'o //
translated: “If one indulges in, becomes habituated to, and increases acts of sexual misconduct, one will be born in the realms of hell beings, animals, and hungry ghosts.

original: gal te mir skyes na'ang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu de'i chung ma gus pa med par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te mir skyes na'ang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu de'i chung ma gus pa med par 'gyur /
translated: “If one is born with the general lot in life of a human, one will experience the following corresponding effects: one’s spouse will be disrespectful;

original: don med par smra ba ni tshig kyal pa ste /

translated: The fourth verbal fault is not to speak of or rejoice in the generation and production of the unwholesome courses of action, and not to dwell on the idle speech of others.

analyzed: yid kyi mi dge ba'i las kyi lam ni brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba'o //

analyzed: 'di ni bdag gir bya'o snyam pa yang dag pa ma yin pa'i tshul bzhin yid la byed cing /

analyzed: yid du mi 'ong ba'i rnam par smin pa /

original: yid ma zhi ba /
analyzed: yid ma zhi ba /

original: ro myong bar byed /

analyzed: rtag tu dga' bar byed cing gzhan gyi nor rdzas phun sum tshogs pa mthong na sdug bsngal ba yin no //

original: 'di ni brnab sems zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni brnab sems zhes bya ste /

analyzed: yid kyi mi dge ba'i las kyi lam gyi dri ma chen po yin no //

analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa des /

analyzed: gnod sems de ni sems can dmyal ba myong bar 'gyur /

analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa'am /
translated: The spiritual practitioner who carefully observes inner phenomena with knowledge derived from hearing or

analyzed: chos zad par byed pa /
