translated: What are the good qualities of the precious horse of a universal monarch?

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa'am lha'i mig gis mthong ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa'am lha'i mig gis mthong ste /
translated: Yogis and yoginis who carefully observe inner phenomena see with knowledge derived from hearing or with the divine eye that🔽

original: rta rin po che ngang pa dang / me tog ku mu da ltar dkar ba yin /
analyzed: rta rin po che ngang pa dang / me tog ku mu da ltar dkar ba yin /
translated: Yogācāra practitioners who carefully observe inner phenomena see with knowledge derived from hearing or with the divine eye that the precious horse is white like a goose or a kumuta flower.

original: kun nas lha'i nor bu'i gtsug la sogs pa mtshan bzang pos brgyan pa yin /
analyzed: kun nas lha'i nor bu'i gtsug la sogs pa mtshan bzang pos brgyan pa yin /
translated: It is completely adorned with excellent marks such as a crest jewel.

original: bong stong dang / mdog dang / dbyibs phun sum tshogs pa yin /
analyzed: bong stong dang / mdog dang / dbyibs phun sum tshogs pa yin /
translated: It is a thousand leagues in size and has perfect color and shape.

original: bsgo na nyin gcig gis dzambu'i gling lan gsum du skor bar byed la /
analyzed: bsgo na nyin gcig gis dzambu'i gling lan gsum du skor bar byed la /
translated: If ordered, it can circle the world three times in a single day.

original: de'i lus dag la shin tu nad med pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i lus dag la shin tu nad med pa yin te /
translated: Its body is completely free of disease.

original: 'di ni 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i rin po che lnga pa yin no //🔽de nas gzhan yang /
analyzed: 'di ni 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i rin po che lnga pa yin no // de nas gzhan yang /
translated: This is the fifth precious object of a wheel-turning monarch.

original: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i blon po rin po che ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i blon po rin po che ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is the precious minister of a wheel-turning monarch like?

original: rnal 'byor spyod @200a *//
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod @200a *//
translated: Yogācāra practitioners who carefully observe inner phenomena see with knowledge derived from hearing or with the divine eye that the precious minister is a human being who is wise, intelligent, and skilled.

original: pa nang gi chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa'am /
analyzed: pa nang gi chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa'am /
translated: The internal phenomena of the body are the object of observation of the internal aspect of internal and external.🔽

original: lha'i mig gis mthong ste /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong ste /
translated: “The spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal phenomena will, with knowledge derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye,🔽perceive the following qualities of the precious minister:

original: blon po rin po che'i yon tan ni 'di dag yin te; 'di lta ste /
analyzed: blon po rin po che'i yon tan ni 'di dag yin te; 'di lta ste /
translated: The precious minister possesses the following qualities:

original: gang rgyal po'i bya ba'i rnam pa yid la sems pa de nyid ma bsgos kyang de'i yid kyis shes nas /
analyzed: gang rgyal po'i bya ba'i rnam pa yid la sems pa de nyid ma bsgos kyang de'i yid kyis shes nas /
translated: Whatever the king thinks of doing, the minister will know it with his mind, even if he has not been told.

original: rgyal po la yongs su 'bul bar byed de /
analyzed: rgyal po la yongs su 'bul bar byed de /
translated: He will then present it to the king.

original: shin tu rdzogs pa dang / de bsags pa dang / ma chags pa dang / chos ma yin pa rnam par spangs pa dang / shin tu rigs pa brtsams pa dang / yul dang / dus dang ldan pa dang / nyon mongs med pa dang /
analyzed: shin tu rdzogs pa dang / de bsags pa dang / ma chags pa dang / chos ma yin pa rnam par spangs pa dang / shin tu rigs pa brtsams pa dang / yul dang / dus dang ldan pa dang / nyon mongs med pa dang /
translated: He is very thorough, he accumulates, he is not attached, he has abandoned unrighteousness, he is very reasonable, he is timely, he is not agitated,

original: gzhan la gnod pa med pa dang / skye bo la rnam par mi 'tshe ba dang / yang dag pa'i tha snyad dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin la skyo ba med do //
analyzed: gzhan la gnod pa med pa dang / skye bo la rnam par mi 'tshe ba dang / yang dag pa'i tha snyad dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin la skyo ba med do //
translated: he does not harm others, he does not harm people, and he is by nature not weary of proper conduct.

original: rgyal po'i bya ba'i rnam pa'am /
analyzed: rgyal po'i bya ba'i rnam pa'am /
translated: Whatever the king thinks of doing,

original: chos kyi don gyi bya ba 'dod pa dang ldan zhing ma 'ongs pa'i bya ba dang ldan pa thams cad yongs su 'bul bar byed do /
analyzed: chos kyi don gyi bya ba 'dod pa dang ldan zhing ma 'ongs pa'i bya ba dang ldan pa thams cad yongs su 'bul bar byed do /
translated: He is dedicated to the Dharma and to the welfare of all beings in the future.

original: 'di ni 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i blon po rin po che yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i blon po rin po che yin te /
translated: This is the precious minister of the universal monarch.

original: lhag pa'i gnod sems spangs pa'i dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam spyod pa dag ni 'jig rten thams cad la pha ma ltar phan par 'dod par gnas pa yin no //🔽de nas gzhan yang /
analyzed: lhag pa'i gnod sems spangs pa'i dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam spyod pa dag ni 'jig rten thams cad la pha ma ltar phan par 'dod par gnas pa yin no // de nas gzhan yang /
translated: He is dedicated to the welfare of the entire world, like a parent, and he practices the ten virtuous actions, having abandoned malice.

original: ji ltar na bdun pa khyim bdag rin po che 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar na bdun pa khyim bdag rin po che 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: “The spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal phenomena of the world will then also ask himself, ‘How does the precious householder come into being?

original: khyim bdag rin po che de'i yon tan ni du zhig yod ce na /🔽rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa'am /
analyzed: khyim bdag rin po che de'i yon tan ni du zhig yod ce na / rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa'am /
translated: What are the qualities of the precious householder?’

original: lha'i mig gis mthong @200b ste; rgyal ba'i bka' nyan pa khyim bdag rin po che'i yon tan ni 'di dag yin te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong @200b ste; rgyal ba'i bka' nyan pa khyim bdag rin po che'i yon tan ni 'di dag yin te /🔽'di lta ste /
translated: With knowledge derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye, he will then notice, ‘The precious householder who obeys the Victorious One’s words possesses the following qualities.

original: rdo rje dang / rin po che mthon ga dang / mrgad dang / spug la sogs pa rin po che rnams kyis dam grogs dang; g-yang sa dang / ri khrod dang / mi mthun pa gzhan dag tu ma bskos kyang shin tu 'gengs la rin po che rnams kyang zad pa med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: rdo rje dang / rin po che mthon ga dang / mrgad dang / spug la sogs pa rin po che rnams kyis dam grogs dang; g-yang sa dang / ri khrod dang / mi mthun pa gzhan dag tu ma bskos kyang shin tu 'gengs la rin po che rnams kyang zad pa med par 'gyur na /
translated: He is filled with jewels such as diamonds, sapphires, emeralds, rubies, and so forth, even though he has not been appointed to do so.

original: gser dang / dngul lta zhig smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: gser dang / dngul lta zhig smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: He is filled with jewels that are inexhaustible, not to mention gold and silver.

original: khyim bdag rin po che 'di'i 'byor pa ni shin tu gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: khyim bdag rin po che 'di'i 'byor pa ni shin tu gnas pa yin te /
translated: The prosperity of this precious householder is very stable.

original: g-yo med pa dang / sgyu med pa dang / gzhan la mi gnod pa dang / skye bo thams cad dga' ba ni khyim bdag rin po che yin no //
analyzed: g-yo med pa dang / sgyu med pa dang / gzhan la mi gnod pa dang / skye bo thams cad dga' ba ni khyim bdag rin po che yin no //
translated: He is a precious householder who is without deceit, without pretense, who does not harm others, and who is loved by all people.

original: de ltar rgyal po rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa ni mi'i gnas bzhi rnams la sgo bar byed cing klu dang / lha'i ris gnyis dang / rgyal chen bzhi dang / sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams kyi dbang po'i stan phyed 'phrog pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar rgyal po rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa ni mi'i gnas bzhi rnams la sgo bar byed cing klu dang / lha'i ris gnyis dang / rgyal chen bzhi dang / sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams kyi dbang po'i stan phyed 'phrog pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the precious king who possesses the seven treasures rules over the four human continents and takes half of the throne of the lord of the gods in the two god realms of the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyikas and the Trāyastriṃśa gods.

original: de ltar 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the universal monarch possesses the seven precious treasures.

original: de'i nye ba'i rin po che sna bdun ni rin po che de dag las cung zad dman pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i nye ba'i rin po che sna bdun ni rin po che de dag las cung zad dman pa yin te /
translated: His seven secondary precious treasures are slightly inferior to those.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: ral gri nye ba'i rin po che dang / pags pa nye ba'i rin po che dang / mal cha nye ba'i rin po che dang / tshal nye ba'i rin po che dang / khyim nye ba'i rin po che dang / gos nye ba'i rin po che dang /
analyzed: ral gri nye ba'i rin po che dang / pags pa nye ba'i rin po che dang / mal cha nye ba'i rin po che dang / tshal nye ba'i rin po che dang / khyim nye ba'i rin po che dang / gos nye ba'i rin po che dang /
translated: the secondary precious sword, the secondary precious hide, the secondary precious bed, the secondary precious park, the secondary precious house, the secondary precious garment,

original: lham nye ba'i rin po che'o //
analyzed: lham nye ba'i rin po che'o //
translated: and the secondary precious footwear.

original: de la 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i ral gri nye ba'i rin po che'i yon tan ni /
analyzed: de la 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i ral gri nye ba'i rin po che'i yon tan ni /
translated: The sword of the universal emperor, the precious jewel of the sword, has the following good qualities.🔽

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The sword, the precious wheel-treasure’s attendant treasure, has the following qualities.🔽The sword is a precious gem.

original: yul 'khor gang dag rgyal po'i yid dang / tshig las 'gal ba byed 'dod pa de @201a *//
analyzed: yul 'khor gang dag rgyal po'i yid dang / tshig las 'gal ba byed 'dod pa de @201a *//
translated: If any of the king’s subjects wish to rebel against the king’s mind and speech,

original: ral gri nye ba'i rin po che 'gro ste /
analyzed: ral gri nye ba'i rin po che 'gro ste /
translated: the sword, the precious attendant treasure, goes to them.

original: des btab pa med cing ral gri rin po ches su la'ang btab pa med kyis kyang yul 'khor kun gyis mthong nas 'dud par byed do //
analyzed: des btab pa med cing ral gri rin po ches su la'ang btab pa med kyis kyang yul 'khor kun gyis mthong nas 'dud par byed do //
translated: Without the sword striking anyone, all the subjects see it and submit.

original: nye ba'i rin po che de'i yon tan ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: nye ba'i rin po che de'i yon tan ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the quality of the sword, the precious attendant treasure.

original: bzang ba mi zad pa /
analyzed: bzang ba mi zad pa /
translated: It is good and inexhaustible.

original: chad pa med cing mtshon gyis bda' ba med kyang yul 'khor de dag thams cad 'dud par byed de /
analyzed: chad pa med cing mtshon gyis bda' ba med kyang yul 'khor de dag thams cad 'dud par byed de /
translated: Without punishment or the threat of weapons, all the subjects submit.

original: 'di ni ral gri nye ba'i rin po che'i yon tan yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni ral gri nye ba'i rin po che'i yon tan yin no //
translated: This is the quality of the sword, the precious attendant treasure.

original: pags pa nye ba'i rin po che'i yon tan ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: pags pa nye ba'i rin po che'i yon tan ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What are the qualities of the skin, the precious attendant treasure?

original: pags pa rin po che ni rgya mtsho nas 'byung ste /
analyzed: pags pa rin po che ni rgya mtsho nas 'byung ste /
translated: The precious skin comes from the ocean.

original: de byung bar gyur pa dang / tshong ba dag gis rgyal po la 'bul bar byed do //
analyzed: de byung bar gyur pa dang / tshong ba dag gis rgyal po la 'bul bar byed do //
translated: When it appears, the merchants offer it to the king.

original: de'i yon tan ni 'di dag yin no //
analyzed: de'i yon tan ni 'di dag yin no //
translated: These are its qualities.

original: de rgya mtsho'i klu'i pags pa yin te /
analyzed: de rgya mtsho'i klu'i pags pa yin te /
translated: It is the skin of the ocean nāga.

original: zheng du dpag tshad lnga la chur dpag tshad bcu ste /
analyzed: zheng du dpag tshad lnga la chur dpag tshad bcu ste /
translated: It is five yojanas wide and ten yojanas long.

original: de char gyis mi rlan /
analyzed: de char gyis mi rlan /
translated: It is not moistened by rain.

original: rlung gis mi bskyod /
analyzed: rlung gis mi bskyod /
translated: It is not moved by wind.

original: mes mi tshig /🔽grang na dro bar byed cing /
analyzed: mes mi tshig / grang na dro bar byed cing /
translated: It is not burned by fire.🔽When it is cold, it warms.

original: dro na bde ba bsil bar byed la /
analyzed: dro na bde ba bsil bar byed la /
translated: When it is hot, it cools.

original: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po 'khor dang bcas pa gang du 'gro ba der blon po rin po ches de khyer bar byed de /
analyzed: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po 'khor dang bcas pa gang du 'gro ba der blon po rin po ches de khyer bar byed de /
translated: Wherever the universal monarch and his retinue go, the precious minister carries it.

original: ji ltar so so nas byed pa ltar de rgyal po'i 'khor gyi khyim gyi bya ba thams cad byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar so so nas byed pa ltar de rgyal po'i 'khor gyi khyim gyi bya ba thams cad byed do //
translated: It does the work of all the king’s retinue, just as each one does.

original: bud med mi sdug pa dag mi mthong zhing dkar ba de dang ldan par 'gyur la zla ba dang / nyi ma'i 'od snang ba de dang yang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bud med mi sdug pa dag mi mthong zhing dkar ba de dang ldan par 'gyur la zla ba dang / nyi ma'i 'od snang ba de dang yang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: One does not see ugly women, and one becomes endowed with that whiteness and also endowed with the light of the sun and moon.

original: gsum pa rgyal po'i mal cha rin po che ni yang zhing 'jam la mtho dma' can yin te /
analyzed: gsum pa rgyal po'i mal cha rin po che ni yang zhing 'jam la mtho dma' can yin te /
translated: The third jewel is the king’s bed, which is light, soft, and has a high and low side.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan ni bteg na 'phar ba dang / mnan na @201b nam byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan ni bteg na 'phar ba dang / mnan na @201b nam byed pa yin no //
translated: The reason is that when it is lifted up, it rises, and when it is pressed down, it sinks.

original: gal te bsam gtan sems na de'i bsam gtan rnam par grol zhing blo gros gsal bar byed /
analyzed: gal te bsam gtan sems na de'i bsam gtan rnam par grol zhing blo gros gsal bar byed /
translated: If the king thinks about concentration, his concentration will be liberated and his intellect will become clear.

original: gal te 'dod chags kyis zil gyis non pa yin na de mal cha'i steng du 'dug na /
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags kyis zil gyis non pa yin na de mal cha'i steng du 'dug na /
translated: If he is overcome by desire, when he sits on the bed,

original: de'i tshe 'dod chags dang bral zhing chags pa med par byed do //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'dod chags dang bral zhing chags pa med par byed do //
translated: he will become free from desire and will not be attached.

original: zhe sdang dang / gti mug dag la'ang de bzhin te /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang / gti mug dag la'ang de bzhin te /
translated: The same is true for hatred and ignorance.

original: mal cha nye ba'i rin po che ni bsam gtan gyi gnas dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: mal cha nye ba'i rin po che ni bsam gtan gyi gnas dang 'dra'o //
translated: The jewel of the bed is like the place for concentration.

original: rgyal po mal cha rin po che'i nang na 'dug pa bud med kyis mthong la de'i tshe mchog tu dga' ba skyes kyang yid la shin tu 'dod chags par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyal po mal cha rin po che'i nang na 'dug pa bud med kyis mthong la de'i tshe mchog tu dga' ba skyes kyang yid la shin tu 'dod chags par mi 'gyur te /
translated: When the king is in the jewel bed, a woman sees him and at that time supreme joy arises, but he does not become very attached in his mind.

original: gsum pa 'di ni mal cha nye ba'i rin po che'i yon tan yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa 'di ni mal cha nye ba'i rin po che'i yon tan yin no //
translated: This is the third quality of the precious bed.

original: bzhi pa tshal nye ba'i rin po che yon tan du yod ce na /
analyzed: bzhi pa tshal nye ba'i rin po che yon tan du yod ce na /
translated: “What are the qualities of the precious park?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows—

original: gal te rgyal po tshal du bsam gtan la dga' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rgyal po tshal du bsam gtan la dga' bar 'gyur te /
translated: if the king wishes to enjoy concentration in the park,

original: de der nye bar 'gro na tshal de'i mthu dang / rgyal po'i dge ba'i las kyis gang lha'i 'jig rten gyi tshal gyi dga' ba'i rnam pa me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / bya dang / padma dang; lteng ka dang / 'bab pa'i chu ngogs bde ba dang /
analyzed: de der nye bar 'gro na tshal de'i mthu dang / rgyal po'i dge ba'i las kyis gang lha'i 'jig rten gyi tshal gyi dga' ba'i rnam pa me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / bya dang / padma dang; lteng ka dang / 'bab pa'i chu ngogs bde ba dang /
translated: then, when he approaches it, by the power of the park and the king’s virtuous karma, all the delightful features of the divine world’s parks—with their flowers, fruits, birds, lotuses, ponds, and delightful riverbanks—

original: lha'i bu mo dag rol mo byed cing /
analyzed: lha'i bu mo dag rol mo byed cing /
translated: and the divine maidens who play music,

original: dgod la mdzes pa rtse ba de dag thams cad lha'i ris de nas tshal der nye bar 'ong ste /
analyzed: dgod la mdzes pa rtse ba de dag thams cad lha'i ris de nas tshal der nye bar 'ong ste /
translated: laugh, and enjoy themselves—all of them will come from that divine realm to that park.

original: rgyal po de'ang lha bzhin du lha'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dag dang ldan par 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyal po de'ang lha bzhin du lha'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dag dang ldan par 'gyur /
translated: The king will be endowed with the five divine sense pleasures, just like the gods.

original: tshal nye ba'i rin po che der bud med dang lhan cig shin tu dga' zhing dga' mgur spyod par byed de /🔽dge ba'i las kyi rnal 'byor spyod pa de bzhi @202a *//
analyzed: tshal nye ba'i rin po che der bud med dang lhan cig shin tu dga' zhing dga' mgur spyod par byed de / dge ba'i las kyi rnal 'byor spyod pa de bzhi @202a *//
translated: In this forest of precious gems, he will enjoy himself with women and experience the pleasures of the five senses.

original: pa tshal nye ba'i rin po che mthong nas gnas so //
analyzed: pa tshal nye ba'i rin po che mthong nas gnas so //
translated: “The one who practices virtuous actions will see the forest of precious gems and stay there.

original: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i khyim nye ba'i rin po che ji lta bu yin /
analyzed: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i khyim nye ba'i rin po che ji lta bu yin /
translated: “What is the precious gem of the house of a universal monarch like?

original: yon tan ni du zhig dang ldan zhe na; 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yon tan ni du zhig dang ldan zhe na; 'di lta ste /
translated: What qualities does it possess?

original: gang 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i khyim nye ba'i rin po che'i nang du nyal bar gyur na /
analyzed: gang 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i khyim nye ba'i rin po che'i nang du nyal bar gyur na /
translated: When the precious gem of the house of a universal monarch is placed inside a house,

original: mtshan mo nyal ba de'i tshe zla ba lta bar 'dod na 'ong zhing gza' dang / rgyu skar dang; skar mda' dag kyang de'i khyim der nye bar 'ong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: mtshan mo nyal ba de'i tshe zla ba lta bar 'dod na 'ong zhing gza' dang / rgyu skar dang; skar mda' dag kyang de'i khyim der nye bar 'ong bar 'gyur /
translated: at night when the universal monarch goes to sleep, if he wishes to see the moon, it will come, and the planets, stars, and meteors will also come to his house.

original: de'i nor bu'ang mthong na dga' bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i nor bu'ang mthong na dga' bar 'gyur /
translated: If he looks at the gem, he will be delighted.

original: lha mo dag kyang lha'i rol mo byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: lha mo dag kyang lha'i rol mo byed par 'gyur /
translated: Goddesses will play divine music.

original: gang mya ngan mang po dang bral ba'i mi de bde bar gnyid log par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang mya ngan mang po dang bral ba'i mi de bde bar gnyid log par 'gyur /
translated: The person who is free from many worries sleeps happily.

original: gnyid log pa na rmi lam dge ba mchog tu dga' ba dag mthong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gnyid log pa na rmi lam dge ba mchog tu dga' ba dag mthong bar 'gyur /
translated: When sleeping, he sees virtuous dreams and is supremely happy.

original: grang ba'i dus su ni rlung dro ba ldang zhing /
analyzed: grang ba'i dus su ni rlung dro ba ldang zhing /
translated: When it is cold, warm winds blow.

original: dro ba'i dus su rlung bsil ba reg na bde zhing 'jam pa ldang ngo //
analyzed: dro ba'i dus su rlung bsil ba reg na bde zhing 'jam pa ldang ngo //
translated: When it is hot, cool, pleasant, and gentle breezes blow.

original: mtshan mo thun gsum las thun gnyis la nyal zhing thun gsum pa las gnyid dang bral nas langs te /
analyzed: mtshan mo thun gsum las thun gnyis la nyal zhing thun gsum pa las gnyid dang bral nas langs te /
translated: Of the three watches of the night, he sleeps during two and, having arisen from sleep during the third,

original: bde ba'i chos la gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bde ba'i chos la gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: he remains in a state of happiness.

original: 'di ni 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i khyim nye bar rin po che yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i khyim nye bar rin po che yin no //
translated: This is the jewel of the retinue of a wheel-turning king.

original: gos rin po che rnam pa du yod /
analyzed: gos rin po che rnam pa du yod /
translated: What are the precious garments?

original: yon tan ni du zhig dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: yon tan ni du zhig dang ldan zhe na /
translated: What are their qualities?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: thags bzang zhing mchog tu 'jam la dri mas ma gos pa yin te /
analyzed: thags bzang zhing mchog tu 'jam la dri mas ma gos pa yin te /
translated: They are well-woven, supremely soft, and unstained by impurities.

original: gyon nas grang ba dang / dro ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / nyam chung ba dang / ngal ba dang / dub pa'i gnod pa med la /
analyzed: gyon nas grang ba dang / dro ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / nyam chung ba dang / ngal ba dang / dub pa'i gnod pa med la /
translated: When wearing them, one is not harmed by cold, heat, hunger, thirst, weakness, fatigue, or exhaustion.

original: me dang @202b mtshon dag gis bsreg pa dang / gcad par mi nus so //
analyzed: me dang @202b mtshon dag gis bsreg pa dang / gcad par mi nus so //
translated: They cannot be burned by fire or cut by weapons.

original: de nas gzhan yang /
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i lha ma nye bar rin po che ji lta bu yin zhe na /🔽rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa'am /
analyzed: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i lha ma nye bar rin po che ji lta bu yin zhe na / rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa'am /
translated: what is the precious gem of a universal monarch?

original: lha'i mig gis brtags na lham nye ba'i rin po che 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rkang pa la gyon na ji ltar skam sa la rkang pa mi 'bying ba de bzhin du chu la'ang mi 'bying bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha'i mig gis brtags na lham nye ba'i rin po che 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rkang pa la gyon na ji ltar skam sa la rkang pa mi 'bying ba de bzhin du chu la'ang mi 'bying bar 'gyur ro //
translated: A spiritual practitioner who carefully observes inner phenomena knows or sees with the divine eye that when the precious gem of a shoe is worn on the feet of a universal monarch, just as the feet do not sink into dry land, they also do not sink into water.

original: gal te dal gyis sngon du 'gro bar 'dod na dpag tshad brgyar yang 'gro bar 'gyur zhing lus la ngal ba med de /
analyzed: gal te dal gyis sngon du 'gro bar 'dod na dpag tshad brgyar yang 'gro bar 'gyur zhing lus la ngal ba med de /
translated: If he wishes to travel slowly, he can travel a hundred leagues without his body becoming tired.

original: 'di dag ni 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po rin po che sna bdun dang / nye ba'i rin po che sna bdun dag la spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po rin po che sna bdun dang / nye ba'i rin po che sna bdun dag la spyod pa yin te /
translated: These are the seven precious substances and the seven precious objects of a universal monarch.

original: mi'i gnas bzhi dang / lha'i rigs gnyis la nye bar spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: mi'i gnas bzhi dang / lha'i rigs gnyis la nye bar spyod pa yin no //
translated: He enjoys the four human abodes and two divine abodes.

original: de'i bu dpa' zhing rtul phod la pha rol gyi sde rab tu 'joms pa stong tham pa yod de /
analyzed: de'i bu dpa' zhing rtul phod la pha rol gyi sde rab tu 'joms pa stong tham pa yod de /
translated: He has a thousand sons, who are brave and heroic, and who conquer all enemies.

original: de dag 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po la phyag byed do //
analyzed: de dag 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po la phyag byed do //
translated: They pay homage to the universal monarch.

original: gnod sems mi dge ba'i las spangs pa ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyi rgyu mthun pa bde ba de dag myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod sems mi dge ba'i las spangs pa ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyi rgyu mthun pa bde ba de dag myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Abandoning the unwholesome action of malice, he experiences the happiness that is the natural outcome of the path of the ten wholesome actions.

original: de nas gzhan yang /
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang /
translated: Furthermore,

original: 'khor ba thams cad kyi sa bon du gyur pa /
analyzed: 'khor ba thams cad kyi sa bon du gyur pa /
translated: the seed of all cyclic existence,

original: thog ma med pa'i dus nas mun pa mun nag tu gyur pa /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus nas mun pa mun nag tu gyur pa /
translated: the darkness of beginningless time,

original: yang dag par sbyor ba thams cad kyi bag la nyal du gyur pa log par lta ba spangs pa ji lta bu yin /
analyzed: yang dag par sbyor ba thams cad kyi bag la nyal du gyur pa log par lta ba spangs pa ji lta bu yin /
translated: the latent tendency of all wrong practices, what is the abandonment of wrong views?

original: yang dag pa'i lta bas 'khor ba las grol ba ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta bas 'khor ba las grol ba ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: How is one liberated from cyclic existence through the correct view?

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi @203a *//🔽chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa'am /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi @203a *// chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa'am /
translated: Yogis and yoginis who abide in the observation of inner phenomena

original: lha'i mig gis mthong ste /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong ste /
translated: see with knowledge derived from hearing or with the divine eye.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa des chos la chos kyi rjes su mthong ba ni 'di la log par lta ba spangs shing /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa des chos la chos kyi rjes su mthong ba ni 'di la log par lta ba spangs shing /
translated: Yogis and yoginis who observe phenomena see that in this life wrong views are abandoned.

original: de'i yang dag pa'i lta bas don med pa thams cad spangs la /
analyzed: de'i yang dag pa'i lta bas don med pa thams cad spangs la /
translated: Through their correct view, all that is meaningless is abandoned.

original: yang dag pa'i sbyor ba'i bag la nyal 'dor bar 'gyur /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i sbyor ba'i bag la nyal 'dor bar 'gyur /
translated: The latent dispositions of incorrect engagement are removed.

original: de mya ngan las 'das pa nye bar 'gyur zhing 'khor ba dang / ring bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de mya ngan las 'das pa nye bar 'gyur zhing 'khor ba dang / ring bar 'gyur /
translated: They approach nirvana and distance themselves from cyclic existence.

original: 'di la log par lta ba rnam pa lnga mthong nas dbang po lnga bsgrubs par 'gyur ba ni skyes bu dam pa dam pa'i chos la mngon par dga' ba de thog ma nas 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi yon tan de dag rnar thos nas de'i tshe 'di ltar
analyzed: 'di la log par lta ba rnam pa lnga mthong nas dbang po lnga bsgrubs par 'gyur ba ni skyes bu dam pa dam pa'i chos la mngon par dga' ba de thog ma nas 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi yon tan de dag rnar thos nas de'i tshe 'di ltar
translated: “Having seen the five kinds of wrong views, they will accomplish the five faculties. Those who are holy beings who delight in the holy Dharma will, from the beginning, hear about the qualities of the Buddha in this way.

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs la dmigs shing 'gro ba lnga rnams la 'jigs pa chen po lnga dmigs te /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs la dmigs shing 'gro ba lnga rnams la 'jigs pa chen po lnga dmigs te /
translated: At that time, they will observe the various sufferings of saṃsāra and the five great fears of the five classes of beings.

original: lha rnams la bag med pas 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal dang / mi rnams la 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal dang / sems can dmyal ba rnams la gnod pa'i sdug bsngal dang; yi dvags rnams la bkres pa dang / skom pa'i sdug bsngal dang / dud 'gro rnams la gcig la gcig za ba'i sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: lha rnams la bag med pas 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal dang / mi rnams la 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal dang / sems can dmyal ba rnams la gnod pa'i sdug bsngal dang; yi dvags rnams la bkres pa dang / skom pa'i sdug bsngal dang / dud 'gro rnams la gcig la gcig za ba'i sdug bsngal te /
translated: The gods have the suffering of death due to their carelessness, humans have the suffering of desire, hell beings have the suffering of harm, pretas have the suffering of hunger and thirst, and animals have the suffering of eating each other.

original: de ltar rnam pa lnga po de dag rnam pa du ma yod cing sdug bsngal gyi yan lag dbye ba dag dpag tu med par dmigs so //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa lnga po de dag rnam pa du ma yod cing sdug bsngal gyi yan lag dbye ba dag dpag tu med par dmigs so //
translated: These five aspects have many aspects, and the divisions of the members of suffering are observed to be immeasurable.

original: de'i tshe 'di ltar thog ma nyid du 'khor ba thams cad las nges par byung bar gyur cing snang bar gyur la dam pa'i chos nges @203b par 'byed pa'i cha lam rab tu 'byung bar sems bskyed de /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di ltar thog ma nyid du 'khor ba thams cad las nges par byung bar gyur cing snang bar gyur la dam pa'i chos nges @203b par 'byed pa'i cha lam rab tu 'byung bar sems bskyed de /
translated: At that time, in this way, first of all, having become definitely emerged from all cyclic existences, having become illuminated, having generated the thought of going forth in the path of definite discernment of the true Dharma,

original: de'i sems bskyed pa gcig las dge ba'i chos kyi rgyun nyid skye'o //
analyzed: de'i sems bskyed pa gcig las dge ba'i chos kyi rgyun nyid skye'o //
translated: from that one generation of the thought, the stream of virtuous dharmas itself is generated.

original: gang gis de'i sems bskyed pa de dang yang dag par ldan pa la bar snang la spyod pa'i gnod sbyin rab tu mgu zhing kun tu dga' la rab tu dga' ste /
analyzed: gang gis de'i sems bskyed pa de dang yang dag par ldan pa la bar snang la spyod pa'i gnod sbyin rab tu mgu zhing kun tu dga' la rab tu dga' ste /
translated: By whom that generation of the thought is possessed, the yakṣas who range in the atmosphere are very pleased, are completely delighted, are very joyful,

original: sems rangs par gyur nas yid la rigs kyi bu 'di ming ni 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: sems rangs par gyur nas yid la rigs kyi bu 'di ming ni 'di zhes bya /
translated: having become delighted in mind, think, “The name of this son of good lineage is such-and-such,

original: rigs ni 'di zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rigs ni 'di zhes bya ste /
translated: the lineage is such-and-such,

original: de thog ma med pa'i dus nas 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug rnams spong bar 'dod la /
analyzed: de thog ma med pa'i dus nas 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug rnams spong bar 'dod la /
translated: from beginningless time he has desired to abandon desire, anger, and ignorance,

original: bdud kyi yul gyi dngos po mi 'dod par zhugs pa /
analyzed: bdud kyi yul gyi dngos po mi 'dod par zhugs pa /
translated: He does not desire the things of the realm of Māra.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i yul dag gis dga' pa'i 'dod chags kyi mod las skyes pa'i sred pa dag la kun tu mi dga' ba yin no snyam mo //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i yul dag gis dga' pa'i 'dod chags kyi mod las skyes pa'i sred pa dag la kun tu mi dga' ba yin no snyam mo //
translated: He is not attracted to the objects of the afflictions, nor to the craving that arises from the desire and passion for objects.

original: gzhan yang / log par lta ba dang bral ba'i rigs kyi bu de ni de ltar rtag tu rab tu 'byung ba'i sems kun tu bsten par byed cing goms par byed la mang du byed /
analyzed: gzhan yang / log par lta ba dang bral ba'i rigs kyi bu de ni de ltar rtag tu rab tu 'byung ba'i sems kun tu bsten par byed cing goms par byed la mang du byed /
translated: “Moreover, the noble son who is free from wrong views always cultivates, becomes habituated to, and increases the thought of renunciation.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur byed /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur byed /
translated: He serves the spiritual friend.

original: dam pa'i chos nyan pa la dga' bar 'gyur /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos nyan pa la dga' bar 'gyur /
translated: He delights in listening to the sacred Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos la phyir zhing sems gsal la phyag 'tshal bar byed /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos la phyir zhing sems gsal la phyag 'tshal bar byed /
translated: He is clear-minded and reverential toward the Buddha’s teachings.

original: lus dang / ngag gi las kyi mtha' zhi zhing shin tu gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: lus dang / ngag gi las kyi mtha' zhi zhing shin tu gsal ba yin te /
translated: His physical and verbal actions are peaceful and clear.

original: de ltar de'i lus dang / ngag dang / yid zhi bas nyin mo mnyam par bzhag par bar snang la spyod pa'i gnod sbyin gyis rig nas kun tu dga' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar de'i lus dang / ngag dang / yid zhi bas nyin mo mnyam par bzhag par bar snang la spyod pa'i gnod sbyin gyis rig nas kun tu dga' bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, since his body, speech, and mind are calm, the yakṣas who move in the sky know that he is resting in meditation during the day and are delighted.

original: rigs kyi bu 'di dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sems rab tu dang zhing khyim gyi gnas gzeb lta bur gyur pa la @204a *//
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sems rab tu dang zhing khyim gyi gnas gzeb lta bur gyur pa la @204a *//
translated: “ ‘Son of noble family, since his mind is full of faith in the spiritual teachers, he is not attached to the household, which is like a cage.

original: sems kun tu mi chags /🔽des bdud kyi yul rnams la thog ma med pa'i dus nas zhugs pa'i 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug dag gis 'dod pa'i lha dang lhan cig tu 'du shes dag la chags pa med cing bdud dang lhan cig g-yul 'gyed par 'dod la /
analyzed: sems kun tu mi chags / des bdud kyi yul rnams la thog ma med pa'i dus nas zhugs pa'i 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug dag gis 'dod pa'i lha dang lhan cig tu 'du shes dag la chags pa med cing bdud dang lhan cig g-yul 'gyed par 'dod la /
translated: He is not attached to the objects of desire.

original: nyon mongs pa spong bar 'dod pa de bar snang la spyod pa'i gnod sbyin gyis rig nas kun tu dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spong bar 'dod pa de bar snang la spyod pa'i gnod sbyin gyis rig nas kun tu dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since he is free from attachment to the perceptions that arise from the desires of the gods, and since he wishes to wage war against the māras with the hatred, desire, and ignorance that have been present since beginningless time, the yakṣas who move in the sky know that he wishes to abandon the afflictions and are delighted.

original: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu de de ltar 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal la dmigs nas ches shin tu rab tu 'byung ba'i sems skyed par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu de de ltar 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal la dmigs nas ches shin tu rab tu 'byung ba'i sems skyed par byed de /
translated: Son of noble family, in this way, having focused on the sufferings of cyclic existence, he generates the mind of supreme renunciation.

original: de srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / chang dang / sbyar ba'i chang dang / brdzun du smra ba spangs nas sdom pa len par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / chang dang / sbyar ba'i chang dang / brdzun du smra ba spangs nas sdom pa len par 'gyur ro //
translated: He abandons killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, alcohol, and intoxicants, and takes up the vows.

original: de gang gi tshe dge bsnyen gyi sdom pa rdzogs par spyod par 'gyur bag de'i tshe /
analyzed: de gang gi tshe dge bsnyen gyi sdom pa rdzogs par spyod par 'gyur bag de'i tshe /
translated: When he has completed the vows of a lay practitioner,

original: bar snang la spyod pa'i gnod sbyin kun tu dga' ste /
analyzed: bar snang la spyod pa'i gnod sbyin kun tu dga' ste /
translated: the yakṣas who roam in the sky rejoice.

original: rigs kyi bu che ge mo zhig ming 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu che ge mo zhig ming 'di zhes bya /
translated: “Son of noble family, so-and-so, with such-and-such a name,

original: rus ni 'di zhes bya ba grong khyer che ge mo zhig dang / grong rdal ga ge mo zhig dang / yul ga ge mo zhig tu skra dang / kha spu bregs te chos gos ngur smrig bgos nas yang dag pa'i dad pas khyim nas khyim med par rab tu byung ste /
analyzed: rus ni 'di zhes bya ba grong khyer che ge mo zhig dang / grong rdal ga ge mo zhig dang / yul ga ge mo zhig tu skra dang / kha spu bregs te chos gos ngur smrig bgos nas yang dag pa'i dad pas khyim nas khyim med par rab tu byung ste /
translated: He is of such and such a clan, and in such and such a village, town, or city, he shaved off his hair and beard, put on the orange robes, and with perfect faith went forth from home to homelessness.

original: bdud kyi phyogs ni dams par byed cing /
analyzed: bdud kyi phyogs ni dams par byed cing /
translated: He is bringing down the forces of Māra and

original: dam pa'i chos kyi phyogs ni mtho bar byed /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi phyogs ni mtho bar byed /
translated: raising up the banner of the holy Dharma.🔽He is cutting through the bonds of Māra and freeing beings from the great afflictions of desire, anger, and ignorance.”

original: bdud kyi 'ching ba ni rnam par gcod par byed cing nyon mongs pa chen po 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug las grol bar byed do zhes mngon par sgrogs so //
analyzed: bdud kyi 'ching ba ni rnam par gcod par byed cing nyon mongs pa chen po 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug las grol bar byed do zhes mngon par sgrogs so //
translated: He proclaims this.

original: log @204b par lta ba ni kun tu sbyor ba'i bag la nyal thams cad kyi gzhi yin la /
analyzed: log @204b par lta ba ni kun tu sbyor ba'i bag la nyal thams cad kyi gzhi yin la /
translated: Wrong views are the basis for all the latent tendencies of fetters,

original: yang dag par lta ba ni mtha' mya ngan las 'das pa'i gzhi yin te /
analyzed: yang dag par lta ba ni mtha' mya ngan las 'das pa'i gzhi yin te /
translated: while right views are the basis for the final nirvāṇa.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa bas chos de rjes su mthong ngo //
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa bas chos de rjes su mthong ngo //
translated: The spiritual practitioner sees this.

original: de'i tshe 'di ltar thog ma nyid du yang dag pa'i lta ba la mngon par bstod par byed de /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di ltar thog ma nyid du yang dag pa'i lta ba la mngon par bstod par byed de /
translated: At that time, he praises right view in this way:

original: mi rgod mi smod skyon du mi 'grang la pha rol dag la bstod par byed cing rab tu 'jog par byed do; ;log par lta ba la smod de /
analyzed: mi rgod mi smod skyon du mi 'grang la pha rol dag la bstod par byed cing rab tu 'jog par byed do; ;log par lta ba la smod de /
translated: He does not criticize or disparage it, but praises and establishes it for others. He criticizes wrong view,

original: bstod par mi byed la smod par byed do //
analyzed: bstod par mi byed la smod par byed do //
translated: does not praise it, but disparages it.

original: yang dag par lta bas ni log par lta ba las dang / chos dang / rnam par smin pa yang dag par mngon par ston par byed cing 'jog par mi byed do //
analyzed: yang dag par lta bas ni log par lta ba las dang / chos dang / rnam par smin pa yang dag par mngon par ston par byed cing 'jog par mi byed do //
translated: He teaches the right view of action, phenomena, and ripening, and does not establish it.

original: 'ching ba rnams kyi rtsa ba ni log par lta ba yin te /
analyzed: 'ching ba rnams kyi rtsa ba ni log par lta ba yin te /
translated: The root of all bonds is wrong view.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi 'ching ba yin zhing 'byung po rnams dang / sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags kyi yul du gnas pa'i mtha' yin no //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi 'ching ba yin zhing 'byung po rnams dang / sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags kyi yul du gnas pa'i mtha' yin no //
translated: It is the bond of foolish ordinary beings, and the end of dwelling in the realms of spirits, hell beings, animals, and hungry ghosts.

original: rigs kyi bus de spangs na dge ba du ma de dag thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi bus de spangs na dge ba du ma de dag thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: When a son of noble family abandons it, he attains those many virtues.

original: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu de 'di ltar khyim gyi gnas ni sdug bsngal ba nyam nga ba 'ching bar gyur pa du ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu de 'di ltar khyim gyi gnas ni sdug bsngal ba nyam nga ba 'ching bar gyur pa du ma yin te /
translated: Son of noble family, in this way, the household life is suffering, miserable, and full of bondage.

original: rang dbang med par rig nas khyim nas 'byung zhing rab tu 'byung bar 'dod la bdud dang lhan cig g-yul 'gyed par 'dod pa'i skyes bu dam pa des bla dang / bar snang la spyod pa'i lha dag gis rig nas kun tu dga' ste /
analyzed: rang dbang med par rig nas khyim nas 'byung zhing rab tu 'byung bar 'dod la bdud dang lhan cig g-yul 'gyed par 'dod pa'i skyes bu dam pa des bla dang / bar snang la spyod pa'i lha dag gis rig nas kun tu dga' ste /
translated: Having understood that one is not independent, one wishes to leave the household life and go forth, and to wage war with Māra. When the gods who dwell in the sky and in the intermediate space between the earth and the sky understand this, they are delighted.

original: rgyal po chen po bzhi rnams la kun tu dga' ba'i yid kyis rigs kyi @205a *//
analyzed: rgyal po chen po bzhi rnams la kun tu dga' ba'i yid kyis rigs kyi @205a *//
translated: With a joyful mind, they inform the Four Great Kings:

original: kyi bu 'di zhes bya ba grong che ge mo zhig dang / grong rdal mang ge mo zhig dang / yul ga ge mo zhig tu skra dang / kha spu bregs te /
analyzed: kyi bu 'di zhes bya ba grong che ge mo zhig dang / grong rdal mang ge mo zhig dang / yul ga ge mo zhig tu skra dang / kha spu bregs te /
translated: ‘Son of noble family so-and-so, in such-and-such a village, town, or country, has shaved off his hair and beard,

analyzed: gos ngur smrig bgos nas yang dag pa'i dad pa nyid kyis khyim nas khyim med par rab tu byung ngo //

analyzed: de khyim nas byung bas bdud kyi phyogs ni dams par byed cing dam pa'i chos kyi phyogs ni mngon par mtho bar byed do zhes mngon par bsnyad do //

original: de nas rgyal po chen po bzhi po de dag gis sa bla dang / bar snang la spyod pa'i lha dag dang / gnod sbyin de dag las de skad thos nas yid dga' la bar snang la spyod pa'i gnod sbyin dag rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas rgyal po chen po bzhi po de dag gis sa bla dang / bar snang la spyod pa'i lha dag dang / gnod sbyin de dag las de skad thos nas yid dga' la bar snang la spyod pa'i gnod sbyin dag rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then the Four Great Kings, having heard this from the gods who range in the ground and the atmosphere, and from the yakṣas, will be delighted. The yakṣas who range in the atmosphere will be delighted.

original: de ltar dzambu'i gling gi mi dam pa'i chos dge ba'i gtam gyis spro ba skyes nas /
analyzed: de ltar dzambu'i gling gi mi dam pa'i chos dge ba'i gtam gyis spro ba skyes nas /
translated: In this way, the people of Jambudvīpa will be delighted by the holy Dharma, the discourse on virtue.

analyzed: rigs kyi bu de ji ltar rigs par 'phags pa dge sbyong gi mkhan po la bsnyen bkur byed do //
translated: “Son of noble family, in the appropriate way, he will serve the noble preceptor of the mendicants.

analyzed: bsnyen bkur byas nas kyang skra dang / kha spu bregs shing gos ngur smrig bgos te so sor thar pa'i sdom pa len to //
translated: Having served him, he will shave his hair and beard, don the saffron-colored robes, and take the vows of individual liberation.

original: sdom pa blangs pas sa bla dang / bar snang la spyod pa'i gnod sbyin rnams lhag par kun tu dga' ste /
analyzed: sdom pa blangs pas sa bla dang / bar snang la spyod pa'i gnod sbyin rnams lhag par kun tu dga' ste /
translated: The yakṣas who live in the earth and in the sky are especially delighted by the taking of vows.

original: rgyal po chen po bzhi la dzambu gling na rigs kyi bu che ge mo zhig ces bya ba grong mang ge mo zhig dang / yul ga ge mo zhig tu log par lta ba spangs nas yang dag par lta ba'i las dang / chos yang dag par blangs pa /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po bzhi la dzambu gling na rigs kyi bu che ge mo zhig ces bya ba grong mang ge mo zhig dang / yul ga ge mo zhig tu log par lta ba spangs nas yang dag par lta ba'i las dang / chos yang dag par blangs pa /
translated: They announce to the four great kings, ‘In Jambudvīpa, a certain son of good family, in a certain village, in a certain town, in a certain country, has abandoned wrong views and taken up right views, right actions, and right Dharma.

original: bu dang / chung ma la sred pa dug lta bu /
analyzed: bu dang / chung ma la sred pa dug lta bu /
translated: He has abandoned the poison of craving for wives and children.

original: don med cing nyam nga ba thams cad spangs @205b nas; skra dang / kha spu bregs gos ngur smrig bgos shing so sor thar pa blangs te /
analyzed: don med cing nyam nga ba thams cad spangs @205b nas; skra dang / kha spu bregs gos ngur smrig bgos shing so sor thar pa blangs te /
translated: He has abandoned all meaningless and dangerous things, shaved his head and face, put on the orange robes, and taken the prātimokṣa vows.

original: bdud dang / lhan cig g-yul 'gyed par 'dod pa /
analyzed: bdud dang / lhan cig g-yul 'gyed par 'dod pa /

original: dga' ba'i 'dod chags kyi mod las ksyes pa spong bar 'dod pa yin no zhes mngon par bsnyad do //
analyzed: dga' ba'i 'dod chags kyi mod las ksyes pa spong bar 'dod pa yin no zhes mngon par bsnyad do //
translated: He wishes to abandon the son born from his own desire and passion.’

original: de nas de'i tshe rgyal po chen po bzhi kun tu dga' nas rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams la dzambu'i gling du rigs che ge mo zhig las grong mang ge mo zhig dang / yul ga ge mo zhig du rigs kyi bu che ge mo zhig log par lta ba spangs nas yang dag par lta bas skra dang /
analyzed: de nas de'i tshe rgyal po chen po bzhi kun tu dga' nas rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams la dzambu'i gling du rigs che ge mo zhig las grong mang ge mo zhig dang / yul ga ge mo zhig du rigs kyi bu che ge mo zhig log par lta ba spangs nas yang dag par lta bas skra dang /
translated: Then at that time the four great kings, being delighted, proclaim to the gods of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings: “In Jambudvīpa, in such and such a village, town, city, country, or region, a son of such and such a family, having abandoned wrong views, has taken up the right view.

original: kha spu bregs /
analyzed: kha spu bregs /
translated: He has shaved off his hair and beard,

original: gos ngur smrig bgos nas dad pa nyid kyis khyim nas khyim med par rab tu byung ste /
analyzed: gos ngur smrig bgos nas dad pa nyid kyis khyim nas khyim med par rab tu byung ste /

original: dge slong ga ge mo zhig gi drung du gnas so zhes mngon par sgrogs so //
analyzed: dge slong ga ge mo zhig gi drung du gnas so zhes mngon par sgrogs so //
translated: He has gone to live in the presence of such and such a monk.”

analyzed: de lha rnams kyis thos nas bdud kyi phyogs dams par 'gyur zhing dam pa'i chos kyi phyogs ni 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes yid dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the gods hear this, they are delighted, thinking, “The side of the māras will be diminished, and the side of the true Dharma will increase.”

analyzed: de nas rgyal po chen po bzhi las rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams kyis thos nas shin tu yid dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, having heard this from the four great kings, the gods of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings are also delighted.

original: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu de 'di ltar kha na ma tho ba rdul tsam la'ang 'jigs par lta la bzod cing dul te /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu de 'di ltar kha na ma tho ba rdul tsam la'ang 'jigs par lta la bzod cing dul te /
translated: Moreover, child of noble family, you should regard even the slightest wrongdoing with fear, and be patient and disciplined.

original: sems yang dag par sdom pa /
analyzed: sems yang dag par sdom pa /

original: 'du 'dzi la mi dga' zhing nye bar khro ba med pa /
analyzed: 'du 'dzi la mi dga' zhing nye bar khro ba med pa /

analyzed: rigs nas rigs su nye bar bsten cing sdig pa'i grogs po dang 'grogs par mi byed la yul gyi rnam par rtog pa la lta bar mi byed /
translated: You should rely on those of good family and not associate with evil friends. You should not look at thoughts about objects.

original: bza' ba zhim po mang du mi 'dod cing tshogs ngan pa dang spyod par mi byed /
analyzed: bza' ba zhim po mang du mi 'dod cing tshogs ngan pa dang spyod par mi byed /

analyzed: yul gyi spyod pa la mngon par dga' bar mi byed cing @206a *//

analyzed: nam du'ang mdza' bshes su lta bu'i ngang tshul can du mi byed /

analyzed: yul la spyod pa'i tshul khrims su mi byed cing dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la rtag tu brtson par 'gyur /

analyzed: zhi ba'i zas kyis gnas shing bdud kyi 'ching ba gcod pa la rtag tu brtson par 'gyur /

analyzed: 'byung po rnams la gang mi 'tshe //

analyzed: rtag tu byams sems bzod ldan pa //

analyzed: rtag tu shes ldan dbang po thul //

analyzed: 'di lta ste /

translated: The arising of a neutral mind is a neutral ripening.🔽Having heard a sound with the ear,🔽having smelled an odor with the nose,🔽having tasted a taste with the tongue,🔽having felt a tactile object with the body,🔽having cognized a dharma with the mind, he experiences and correctly discerns the arising of a pleasant mind, which is a defiled, non-virtuous ripening, and the arising of an unpleasant mind, which is a pleasant ripening.

analyzed: btang snyoms kyi gnas su 'gyur ba ni lung du ma bstan pa'i rnam par smin par 'gyur ba yin no //

original: btang snyoms kyi gnas su 'gyur ba ni lung du ma bstan pa'i rnam par smin pa yin no //
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi gnas su 'gyur ba ni lung du ma bstan pa'i rnam par smin pa yin no //
translated: The state of equanimity is the ripened effect of indeterminate factors.

analyzed: btang snyoms kyi gnas su 'gyur ba ni lung du ma bstan pa'i rnam par smin pa yin no //
translated: The state of equanimity is the ripening of a neutral action.

original: de bzhin du lces ro myong nas yid bde ba'i gnas su 'gyur ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa mi dge ba'i rnam par smin pa yin no; ;yid mi bde ba'i gnas su 'gyur ba ni rnam par byang ba dge ba'i rnam par smin pa yin no //

analyzed: btang snyoms kyi gnas su 'gyur ba ni lung du ma bstan pa'i rnam par smin pa yin no //

analyzed: de bzhin du yid kyis chos shes nas /

analyzed: yid bde @209a *//

analyzed: kha spu bregs te /

analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i lha de dag las lha'i dbang po koo shi kas de thos nas yid mchog tu dga' bar 'gyur ba mthong ngo //

analyzed: de nas gzhan yang /

analyzed: la sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams de dag rab tu shes shing rnam par 'byed la so sor rtog go /
translated: the earth element, the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, and the consciousness element.

original: de la sa'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sa'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the earth element?

original: sa'i khams rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sa'i khams rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The earth element is twofold:

original: nang na yod pa dang / phyi rol na yod pa'o //
analyzed: nang na yod pa dang / phyi rol na yod pa'o //
translated: internal and external.

original: de la nang na yod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nang na yod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the internal earth element?

original: lus 'di la gang cung zad nang dang / so so'i nang du bzung ba dang / zin pa'o //
analyzed: lus 'di la gang cung zad nang dang / so so'i nang du bzung ba dang / zin pa'o //
translated: Whatever in this body is hard and grasped as internal and appropriated.

original: de la bzung ba ni pags pa dang / sha la sogs pas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de la bzung ba ni pags pa dang / sha la sogs pas bsdus pa'o //
translated: What is grasped is what is included in skin, flesh, and so on.

original: zin pa ni skra dang / spu dang / sen mo dang / sos bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: zin pa ni skra dang / spu dang / sen mo dang / sos bsdus pa'o //
translated: What is appropriated is what is included in hair, body hair, and nails.

original: sra ba dang / mkhrang ba'i rnam pa ni bzung ba dang / zin pa ste /
analyzed: sra ba dang / mkhrang ba'i rnam pa ni bzung ba dang / zin pa ste /
translated: The grasped and appropriated are the form of hardness and solidity.

original: de'ang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'ang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: 'di lta ste /🔽skra dang / spu dang / sen mo dang / so dang / rdul dang / rang gi sha dang / rus pa dang / rtsa dang / rgyus pa dang / snying dang / mchin pa dang / glo ba dang / mkhal ma dang / mtsher pa dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / skra dang / spu dang / sen mo dang / so dang / rdul dang / rang gi sha dang / rus pa dang / rtsa dang / rgyus pa dang / snying dang / mchin pa dang / glo ba dang / mkhal ma dang / mtsher pa dang /
translated: It is as follows:🔽hair, body hair, nails, teeth, dirt, one’s own flesh, bones, veins, sinews, heart, liver, lungs, kidneys, spleen,

original: mchil ma dang / pho ba dang / long ga dang / rgyu ma dang / gnye ma dang / lto dang / lto ba dang / klad pa dang / klad rgyas rnams so //
analyzed: mchil ma dang / pho ba dang / long ga dang / rgyu ma dang / gnye ma dang / lto dang / lto ba dang / klad pa dang / klad rgyas rnams so //
translated: phlegm, feces, bile, blood, sweat, fat, tears, lymph, saliva, mucus, oil that lubricates the joints, urine, and the brain and membranes that cover the brain.

original: gang gzhan yang /
analyzed: gang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: lus 'di la nang dang / so so'i nang du sra ba dang / mkhrang ba'i rnam pa bzung ba dang / zin pa 'di ni nang gi sa'i khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus 'di la nang dang / so so'i nang du sra ba dang / mkhrang ba'i rnam pa bzung ba dang / zin pa 'di ni nang gi sa'i khams zhes bya'o //
translated: whatever is hard and solid in this body, internally and individually, that is grasped and apprehended is called the internal earth element.

original: de la phyi rol gyi sa'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la phyi rol gyi sa'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the external earth element?

original: phyi rol la gang cung zad sra ba dang / mkhrang ba'i rnam pa ma bzung ba /
analyzed: phyi rol la gang cung zad sra ba dang / mkhrang ba'i rnam pa ma bzung ba /
translated: Whatever is externally hard and solid, not grasped and not apprehended,

original: ma zin pa 'di ni phyi rol gyi sa'i khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma zin pa 'di ni phyi rol gyi sa'i khams zhes bya'o //
translated: this is called the external earth element.

original: de la @210b gang sa'i khams de gcig tu bsdus pa'i khams 'di ni khams tsam ste /🔽tshor bas gnas su ma byas shing 'dod rgyal gyis ma byas pa'i sa'i khams rtag par ma yin /
analyzed: de la @210b gang sa'i khams de gcig tu bsdus pa'i khams 'di ni khams tsam ste / tshor bas gnas su ma byas shing 'dod rgyal gyis ma byas pa'i sa'i khams rtag par ma yin /
translated: The element of earth is a mere element, for it is not a self that is one with the element of earth.

original: bde bar ma yin; gtsang bar ma yin par mthong zhing /🔽de dag tu mi lta ba'i shes rab kyi byin gyis rlabs la lhag par mos pa'i dge slong de ni 'di dag thams cad bdag gi ma yin /
analyzed: bde bar ma yin; gtsang bar ma yin par mthong zhing / de dag tu mi lta ba'i shes rab kyi byin gyis rlabs la lhag par mos pa'i dge slong de ni 'di dag thams cad bdag gi ma yin /
translated: The element of earth is not permanent, not happiness, not self, and not pure.🔽The monk who sees the element of earth in this way, and who is not attached to the element of earth, is said to be liberated.🔽He thinks, ‘These are not my self, nor is this self of mine.

original: de dag bdag ma yin; de dag bdag dang / bdag gi ma yin no snyam mo //
analyzed: de dag bdag ma yin; de dag bdag dang / bdag gi ma yin no snyam mo //
translated: They are not the self. They are not the self’s.🔽

original: 'di dag yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong nas /
analyzed: 'di dag yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong nas /
translated: He sees the element of earth as it really is with right wisdom.

original: sa'i khams la sems 'di 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sa'i khams la sems 'di 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: His mind becomes free from attachment to the element of earth.

original: de ltar dge slong shes rab kyi byin gyi rlabs la lhag par mos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar dge slong shes rab kyi byin gyi rlabs la lhag par mos par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, the monk is said to be devoted to the transformative power of wisdom.

original: de la chu'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chu'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the water element?

original: chu'i khams kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: chu'i khams kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of water element:

original: nang na yod pa dang / phyi rol na yod pa'o //
analyzed: nang na yod pa dang / phyi rol na yod pa'o //
translated: The internal water element and the external water element.🔽The internal water element is whatever in this body is water or has become water,

original: de la nang na yod pa ni lus 'di la gang cung zad chu dang / chu'i rnam pa 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: de la nang na yod pa ni lus 'di la gang cung zad chu dang / chu'i rnam pa 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: has the nature of water, and is appropriated and grasped.🔽The water element is present in the body in the form of moisture. It is found in tears, mucus, spit, grease, oil, marrow, urine, blood, bile, pus, saliva, and brain matter.

original: chu'i khams ni lus la gsher ba'i bdag nyid du yod pa rdul dang; mchil ma dang / snabs dang / klad pa'i sprin dang / khrag dang / zhag dang / chu ser dang / tshil dang / rkang dang / mkhris pa dang / gcing dang /🔽klad rgyas rnams so //
analyzed: chu'i khams ni lus la gsher ba'i bdag nyid du yod pa rdul dang; mchil ma dang / snabs dang / klad pa'i sprin dang / khrag dang / zhag dang / chu ser dang / tshil dang / rkang dang / mkhris pa dang / gcing dang / klad rgyas rnams so //
translated: It is also found in the fluid in the ears, nose, joints, and the fluid that moistens the body.🔽Whatever else there is in this body that is internal, appropriated, and grasped, that is water or has become water,

original: gang gzhan khang lus 'di la nang so so'i nang du chu dang / chu'i rnam pa bzung ba dang / zin pa gang cung zad yod pa 'di ni nang gi chu'i khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gzhan khang lus 'di la nang so so'i nang du chu dang / chu'i rnam pa bzung ba dang / zin pa gang cung zad yod pa 'di ni nang gi chu'i khams zhes bya'o //
translated: has the nature of water, and is not solid food or drink that has been ingested—this is called the internal water element.

original: phyi rol gyi gang zhe na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi gang zhe na /
translated: What is the external water element?

original: gang cung zad kyi phyi rol gyi chu @211a *//
analyzed: gang cung zad kyi phyi rol gyi chu @211a *//
translated: Whatever externally is water or has become water,

original: dang; chu'i rnam par gsher ba dang / gsher ba'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: dang; chu'i rnam par gsher ba dang / gsher ba'i rnam pa ste /
translated: has the nature of water, and is not appropriated or grasped—

original: ma bzung ma zin pa 'di ni phyi rol gyi chu'i khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma bzung ma zin pa 'di ni phyi rol gyi chu'i khams zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the external water element.

original: de la gang nang gi chu'i khams dang; gang phyi rol gyi chu'i khams de dag gcig tu bsdus pa'i khams 'di ni khams tsam ste /🔽'di dag thams cad bdag gi ma yin /
analyzed: de la gang nang gi chu'i khams dang; gang phyi rol gyi chu'i khams de dag gcig tu bsdus pa'i khams 'di ni khams tsam ste / 'di dag thams cad bdag gi ma yin /
translated: The internal water element and the external water element are combined into a single water element.

original: de dag bdag ma yin /
analyzed: de dag bdag ma yin /
translated: This is not the self, not mine, and not my self.🔽This is not the self of others.

original: de dag bdag dang / bdag gi ma yin pa chu'i khams yang dag par mthong nas chu'i khams la sems 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag bdag dang / bdag gi ma yin pa chu'i khams yang dag par mthong nas chu'i khams la sems 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: Seeing the water element as it really is, the mind is freed from the bonds of desire.

original: de ltar dge slong shes rab kyi byin gyi rlabs la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar dge slong shes rab kyi byin gyi rlabs la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: This is the bodhisattva’s entry into the blessing of wisdom.

original: de la me'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la me'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the fire element?

original: me'i khams kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: me'i khams kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The fire element is twofold:

original: nang na yod pa dang / phyi rol na yod pa'o //
analyzed: nang na yod pa dang / phyi rol na yod pa'o //
translated: the internal fire element and the external fire element.

original: de la nang gi me'i khams ni lus 'di la gang la cung zad nang dang / so so'i nang gi me dang / me'i rnam pa bzung ba dang / zin pa'o //
analyzed: de la nang gi me'i khams ni lus 'di la gang la cung zad nang dang / so so'i nang gi me dang / me'i rnam pa bzung ba dang / zin pa'o //
translated: The internal fire element is what is internal, appropriated, and consumed by fire, the nature of heat.

original: de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: gang gis gdung bar byed pa dang / gang gis yongs su sreg par byed pa dang / gang gis 'bar bar byed pa dang / gang gis zos pa dang / 'thung ba dang / 'chos pa dang / myangs pa rnams legs par bde bar 'jug par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: gang gis gdung bar byed pa dang / gang gis yongs su sreg par byed pa dang / gang gis 'bar bar byed pa dang / gang gis zos pa dang / 'thung ba dang / 'chos pa dang / myangs pa rnams legs par bde bar 'jug par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: that which burns, that which completely burns, that which causes burning, that which digests what is eaten, drunk, consumed, and tasted,

original: gang gzhan yang /
analyzed: gang gzhan yang /
translated: and whatever else🔽in this body is fire, fiery, and appropriated and grasped as fire.

original: lus 'di la nang gi dang / so so'i nang gi me dang / me'i rnam pa bzung ba dang / zin pa 'di ni nang gi me'i khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus 'di la nang gi dang / so so'i nang gi me dang / me'i rnam pa bzung ba dang / zin pa 'di ni nang gi me'i khams zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the internal fire element.

original: de la phyi rol gyi me'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la phyi rol gyi me'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the external fire element?

original: phyi rol @211b gyi gang cung zad me dang / me'i rnam pa dang / dro ba dang / dre ba'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: phyi rol @211b gyi gang cung zad me dang / me'i rnam pa dang / dro ba dang / dre ba'i rnam pa ste /
translated: Whatever externally is fire, fiery, heat, and the aspect of heat,🔽unappropriated and ungrasped,

original: mi bzung ma zin pa 'di ni phyi rol gyi me'i khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi bzung ma zin pa 'di ni phyi rol gyi me'i khams zhes bya'o //
translated: this is called the external fire element.

original: de la gang nang gi me'i khams dang / gang phyi rol gyi me'i khams de dag gcig tu bsdus pa'i khams 'di ni khams tsam ste /
analyzed: de la gang nang gi me'i khams dang / gang phyi rol gyi me'i khams de dag gcig tu bsdus pa'i khams 'di ni khams tsam ste /
translated: The internal fire element and the external fire element are combined into one category, the fire element.

original: de dag thams cad bdag gi ma yin /🔽de dag bdag ma yin /
analyzed: de dag thams cad bdag gi ma yin / de dag bdag ma yin /
translated: All of them have been my mother.🔽They are not my self.

original: de dag bdag dang / bdag gi ma yin /
analyzed: de dag bdag dang / bdag gi ma yin /
translated: They are not my self or what belongs to the self.

analyzed: 'di ltar de dag yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong nas me'i khams la sems 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, seeing them as they are in reality with correct wisdom, the mind becomes free from attachment to the fire element.

original: de byed pa bos gnas su ma byas kyang me'i khams rab tu 'jug go /
analyzed: de byed pa bos gnas su ma byas kyang me'i khams rab tu 'jug go /

original: de la rlung gi khams gang zhe na /

original: rlung gi khams rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rlung gi khams rnam pa gnyis te /

original: nang na yod pa dang / phyi rol na yod pa'o //
analyzed: nang na yod pa dang / phyi rol na yod pa'o //
translated: that which is internal and that which is external.

original: de la nang gi gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nang gi gang zhe na /

analyzed: lus 'di la gang cung zad nang dang; so so'i nang gi rlung dang / rlung gi rnam pa yang ba dang / yang zhing g-yo ba bzung ba dang / zin pa ste /
translated: Whatever in this body is wind, windy, and held to be wind, light, and moving, grasped and apprehended.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: steng du 'gro ba'i rlung dang / 'og tu 'gro ba'i rlung dang / ngos su 'gro ba'i rlung dang / ltor 'gro ba'i rlung dang / de bzhin du ral gri dang / khab dang / mtshon cha lta bu'i rlung dang / rlung skran dang / srin bu dang lhan cig rgyu ba'i rlung brgyad cu dag yod do; ;rlung brgyad cu dag yan lag dang /🔽nying lag dag gi rjes su 'jug go /

original: de la phyi rol gyi rlung gi khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la phyi rol gyi rlung gi khams gang zhe na /

analyzed: phyi rol gyi gang cung zad rlung dang / rlung gi rnam pa yang zhing g-yo ba ma bzung ma zin pa 'di ni phyi rol gyi rlung gi khams zhes bya'o //

analyzed: de la nang gi rlung gi khams dang / gang phyi rol gyi de dag thams cad mngon par bsdus pa'i khams 'di ni khams tsam ste; de dag bdag gi ma yin /

original: de dag bdag ma yin /🔽de dag bdag dang / bdag gi ma yin la /
analyzed: de dag bdag ma yin / de dag bdag dang / bdag gi ma yin la /

analyzed: byed pa pos gnas su ma byas shing tshor ba pos gnas su ma byas te /

analyzed: de ltar 'di dag yang dag pa'i shes rab kyi sa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong nas rlung gi khams de la sems 'dod chags dang bral bar byed de /

analyzed: 'di ni shes rab kyi byin gyi rlabs mngon sum du byed pa'i dge slong yin no //

original: de la nam mkha'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nam mkha'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the space element?

original: nam mkha'i khams kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyang rnam pa gnyis te /

translated: Then, when the contact that is conducive to the experience of pleasure ceases, he knows as it really is: “In dependence on the contact that is conducive to the experience of pleasure, the feeling that arose has ceased.”

original: bdag gi bde ba'i tshor ba skyes te /
