translated: examine the four types of contact.

original: des gzhan bzhi pa la 'jug pa ni reg pa'i rkyen gyis bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba bde ba'i rgyu dang / bde ba'i gzhi dang / bde ba'i rkyen gyis bdag gis tshor ba skyes so //
analyzed: des gzhan bzhi pa la 'jug pa ni reg pa'i rkyen gyis bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba bde ba'i rgyu dang / bde ba'i gzhi dang / bde ba'i rkyen gyis bdag gis tshor ba skyes so //
translated: When the fourth type of contact occurs, they understand, “Due to the condition of contact, I experience pleasure. Pleasure is the cause, the basis, and the condition for the arising of pleasant feeling.

original: de 'gags snying rnam par zhi la nang du nub pa de ma thag tu sdug bsngal gyi reg pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi gzhi dang / sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba dang / sdug bsngal nyid kyis bdag gi sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba skyes so //
analyzed: de 'gags snying rnam par zhi la nang du nub pa de ma thag tu sdug bsngal gyi reg pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi gzhi dang / sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba dang / sdug bsngal nyid kyis bdag gi sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba skyes so //
translated: When that ceases, it is completely pacified and subsides internally. Immediately after that, due to the condition of painful contact, the basis of pain, the origin of pain, and pain itself, I experience painful feeling.

original: de bzhin du btang snyoms kyi rkyen dang / reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba so sor mngon par shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du btang snyoms kyi rkyen dang / reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba so sor mngon par shes so //
translated: In the same way, they understand, ‘Due to the condition of neutral contact, I experience neutral feeling.’🔽“

original: skad cig skad cig la bdag gi reg pa'i tshor ba'i grogs dang / reg pa 'byung ba skye ste /
analyzed: skad cig skad cig la bdag gi reg pa'i tshor ba'i grogs dang / reg pa 'byung ba skye ste /
translated: At every moment, the contact that is the companion of the sensation of touch arises and occurs.

original: de bde ba'i tshor ba la mi dga' zhing chags par mi byed la tshor ba de la mngon par mi dga' zhing mang du mi byed de ro myang bar mi byed do //
analyzed: de bde ba'i tshor ba la mi dga' zhing chags par mi byed la tshor ba de la mngon par mi dga' zhing mang du mi byed de ro myang bar mi byed do //
translated: He does not delight in the sensation of pleasure, nor does he become attached to it. He does not delight in that sensation, does not cultivate it, and does not savor it.

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas kyang gnod par mi byed cing rnam par 'tshe bar mi byed la rnyog pa can du mi byed do //🔽de btang snyoms la gnas te dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang ldan pa yin na ni tshor ba gsum po 'di dag gis gal te na gtan du sems 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas kyang gnod par mi byed cing rnam par 'tshe bar mi byed la rnyog pa can du mi byed do // de btang snyoms la gnas te dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang ldan pa yin na ni tshor ba gsum po 'di dag gis gal te na gtan du sems 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur /
translated: Similarly, the sensation of pain does not harm him, does not torment him, and does not disturb him.

original: yang na btang snyoms khyad par can gzhan du 'gyur te; yongs su dag pa dang / rnam par byang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na btang snyoms khyad par can gzhan du 'gyur te; yongs su dag pa dang / rnam par byang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he remains in equanimity, endowed with recollection and awareness, then these three sensations will either cause him to be completely free from attachment or else they will cause him to attain another kind of special equanimity, which is pure and clear.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks to himself:

original: kye ae ma /
analyzed: kye ae ma /
translated: Kye ema!🔽🔽

original: bdag gis nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi btang snyoms 'di ltar yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: bdag gis nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi btang snyoms 'di ltar yongs su dag pa /
translated: “I will perfect this equanimity of the base of infinite space,

original: 'di @215b ltar rnam par byang ba 'di rdzogs par bya zhing bdag gi sems dang mthun par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di @215b ltar rnam par byang ba 'di rdzogs par bya zhing bdag gi sems dang mthun par bya ste /
translated: which is so pure and so refined, and I will bring it into harmony with my mind.

original: bdag gi btang snyoms kyi mthar gtugs pa dang 'bral pa mngon sum du byas la /
analyzed: bdag gi btang snyoms kyi mthar gtugs pa dang 'bral pa mngon sum du byas la /
translated: I will actualize the final limit of equanimity and freedom,

original: de la mchog tu lhag par gnas par bya /
analyzed: de la mchog tu lhag par gnas par bya /
translated: and I will abide in that supreme state.

original: bdag nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi btang snyoms kyis bsdus pa de rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
analyzed: bdag nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi btang snyoms kyis bsdus pa de rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
translated: I will perfect and abide in the equanimity of the base of infinite space.

original: bdag gis 'di ltar yongs su dag cing 'di ltar rnam par byang ba rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi btang snyoms 'di rdzogs par byas te gnas par bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag gis 'di ltar yongs su dag cing 'di ltar rnam par byang ba rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi btang snyoms 'di rdzogs par byas te gnas par bya'o snyam mo //
translated: I will perfect and abide in the equanimity of the base of infinite consciousness, the base of infinite space, the base of nothingness, and the base of neither perception nor non-perception, which is so pure and so refined.”

original: de 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas pa de dang / bdag gi sems mthun par byed la btang snyoms de la gnas shing 'dug ste /
analyzed: de 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas pa de dang / bdag gi sems mthun par byed la btang snyoms de la gnas shing 'dug ste /
translated: He abides in the perfection of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, and his mind is in accord with that. He abides in that equanimity, and remains there.

original: de la lhag par chags pa dang / de nye bar len pa bdag gi 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi btang snyoms rdzogs par byas te gnas par bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: de la lhag par chags pa dang / de nye bar len pa bdag gi 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi btang snyoms rdzogs par byas te gnas par bya'o snyam mo //
translated: He thinks, ‘I will perfect the equanimity of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, and abide in it.’

original: 'di lta ste /🔽dbar na / gser mgar ram /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / dbar na / gser mgar ram /
translated: It is like this:🔽a goldsmith or a goldsmith’s apprentice

original: gser mgar gyi slob ma mkhas pa de so mal du gser 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: gser mgar gyi slob ma mkhas pa de so mal du gser 'jug par byed do //
translated: puts gold in the furnace and works it.

original: bcug nas phra skam gyis bzung zhing yam shing gis 'bud /
analyzed: bcug nas phra skam gyis bzung zhing yam shing gis 'bud /
translated: Having put it in, he holds it with tongs and blows on it with a blowtorch.

original: kun tu 'bud do //
analyzed: kun tu 'bud do //
translated: He blows on it and works it.

original: las legs par byas pa'i gser de dge zhing bkra shis la kha dog bzang ba /
analyzed: las legs par byas pa'i gser de dge zhing bkra shis la kha dog bzang ba /
translated: That gold, well worked, is pure, auspicious, and has a good color.

original: las byed pa /
analyzed: las byed pa /
translated: It is workable,

original: thams cad bstod pa /
analyzed: thams cad bstod pa /
translated: praised by all,

original: kha dog bzang bar bsngags pa /
analyzed: kha dog bzang bar bsngags pa /
translated: and praised for its good color.

original: yul thams cad du rjes su @216a *//
analyzed: yul thams cad du rjes su @216a *//
translated: It is suitable for all ornaments,🔽and is worn by kings,🔽or by the king’s priest,🔽or by the king’s son,🔽or by a powerful king’s minister.

original: mthun par 'jug pa de dri ma dang bral zhing skyon lhag ma'ang med la dul zhing bkra shis te /
analyzed: mthun par 'jug pa de dri ma dang bral zhing skyon lhag ma'ang med la dul zhing bkra shis te /
translated: He is free from stains, without any remaining faults, and is disciplined and auspicious.

original: rin po che'i 'od kyang zil du rlag par byed do //
analyzed: rin po che'i 'od kyang zil du rlag par byed do //
translated: He outshines even the light of jewels.

original: de gser mgar ram; gser mgar gyi slob ma mkhas pa gzhan zhig gis gser legs par sbyang ba byas par rig nas ci 'dod par byed de /
analyzed: de gser mgar ram; gser mgar gyi slob ma mkhas pa gzhan zhig gis gser legs par sbyang ba byas par rig nas ci 'dod par byed de /
translated: A goldsmith or another skilled goldsmith, knowing that the gold has been well refined, does whatever he wants with it.

original: gal te bgo bar bya ba dag la dril bu'i rgyan byed /
analyzed: gal te bgo bar bya ba dag la dril bu'i rgyan byed /
translated: If he wants to make ornaments for the body,

original: gal te shin tu blta na sdug pa dag byed /
analyzed: gal te shin tu blta na sdug pa dag byed /
translated: he makes them very beautiful.

original: gal te dpung rgyan du byed /🔽gal te snying gar mdzes pa'i rgyan byed /
analyzed: gal te dpung rgyan du byed / gal te snying gar mdzes pa'i rgyan byed /
translated: If he wants to make armlets,🔽he makes them beautiful ornaments for the chest.

original: gal te glegs bam la mdzes par byed /
analyzed: gal te glegs bam la mdzes par byed /
translated: If he wants to make them into a book cover,🔽he makes them beautiful.

original: gal te mgo rgyan du byed /🔽gal te sor gdub tu byed /🔽gal te gser gyi phreng bar byed /
analyzed: gal te mgo rgyan du byed / gal te sor gdub tu byed / gal te gser gyi phreng bar byed /
translated: If he wants to make a head ornament,🔽he makes it into a ring.🔽If he wants to make a golden garland,

original: gal te rgyan cod pan du byed /
analyzed: gal te rgyan cod pan du byed /
translated: he makes a crown ornament.

original: gang dang / gang du khyer ba de dang / der las dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang dang / gang du khyer ba de dang / der las dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Wherever he takes it, he will be successful in his work.

original: de bzhin du dge slong shin tu tshul khrims dang ldan pa shes rab can ni bdag gis 'di ltar yongs su dag cing 'di ltar rnam par byang ba gal te nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi btang snyoms de rdzogs par byas la bdag de dang mthun par
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong shin tu tshul khrims dang ldan pa shes rab can ni bdag gis 'di ltar yongs su dag cing 'di ltar rnam par byang ba gal te nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi btang snyoms de rdzogs par byas la bdag de dang mthun par
translated: Similarly, a monk who is very disciplined and wise thinks, ‘If I were to perfect the equanimity of the base of infinite space, I would be pure and cleansed in that way.

original: de la gnas te /
analyzed: de la gnas te /
translated: I would abide in that way.

original: de dang 'brel ba dang / de la lhag par gnas pa dang / de nye bar len cing de nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi btang snyoms rdzogs par byas te gnas /
analyzed: de dang 'brel ba dang / de la lhag par gnas pa dang / de nye bar len cing de nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi btang snyoms rdzogs par byas te gnas /
translated: I would be connected to that, I would abide in that, I would take that up, and I would perfect and abide in the equanimity of the base of infinite space.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
translated: I would perfect and abide in the base of infinite consciousness, the base of nothingness, and the base of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: de 'di snyam du sems @216b te gang bdag gi btang snyoms 'di ni mi rtag pa /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems @216b te gang bdag gi btang snyoms 'di ni mi rtag pa /
translated: He thinks, ‘This equanimity of mine is impermanent,

original: mi brtan pa /
analyzed: mi brtan pa /
translated: unstable,

original: ther zug ma yin pa yongs su 'gyur ba'i chos can yin par de gzugs med pa'i skye mched bzhi po de nyid la dmigs nas bdag gi btang snyoms mi rtag cing mi rtag par dmigs /
analyzed: ther zug ma yin pa yongs su 'gyur ba'i chos can yin par de gzugs med pa'i skye mched bzhi po de nyid la dmigs nas bdag gi btang snyoms mi rtag cing mi rtag par dmigs /
translated: “They observe the four formless spheres and think, ‘My equanimity is impermanent and I observe it as impermanent.

original: mi brtan zhing mi brtan par dmigs te 'dus byas su rig par bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: mi brtan zhing mi brtan par dmigs te 'dus byas su rig par bya'o snyam mo //
translated: I observe it as unstable and unstable, and I know it to be conditioned.’

original: nam mkha'i mtha' yas skye mched mi rtag cing /
analyzed: nam mkha'i mtha' yas skye mched mi rtag cing /
translated: ‘The sphere of infinite space is impermanent,

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dmigs su med pa dang / ci'ang med pa'i skye mched dmigs su med pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi btang snyoms 'di ni g-yo ba dang bral ba yin /
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dmigs su med pa dang / ci'ang med pa'i skye mched dmigs su med pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi btang snyoms 'di ni g-yo ba dang bral ba yin /
translated: the sphere of infinite consciousness is unobservable, the sphere of nothing whatsoever is unobservable, and the equanimity of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception is free from movement.

original: 'di ni zhi ba yin /
analyzed: 'di ni zhi ba yin /
translated: This is peace,

original: 'di ni nye bar phan pa yin no snyam mo //
analyzed: 'di ni nye bar phan pa yin no snyam mo //
translated: this is benefit, this is the state of happiness.’

original: de lus kun tu tshor ba skye zhing myong ba na so sor mngon bar shes shing skyes pa rnams kyang so sor mngon par shes so //
analyzed: de lus kun tu tshor ba skye zhing myong ba na so sor mngon bar shes shing skyes pa rnams kyang so sor mngon par shes so //
translated: “When they experience and feel sensations throughout their bodies, they are aware of them as they arise and are aware of them as they cease.

original: 'gags pa so sor mngon par shes shing 'gag pa'ang so sor mngon par shes so //
analyzed: 'gags pa so sor mngon par shes shing 'gag pa'ang so sor mngon par shes so //
translated: He knows the cessation of each, and he knows the cessation of each.

original: mig gi reg pa las byung ba so sor mngon par shes te /
analyzed: mig gi reg pa las byung ba so sor mngon par shes te /
translated: He knows the feeling that arises from eye contact.

original: de bzhin du rna ba'i reg pa las byung ba so sor mngon par shes /
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba'i reg pa las byung ba so sor mngon par shes /
translated: He knows the feeling that arises from ear contact.

original: sna'i reg pa las byung ba so sor mngon par shes /
analyzed: sna'i reg pa las byung ba so sor mngon par shes /
translated: He knows the feeling that arises from nose contact.

original: de bzhin du lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba so sor mngon par shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba so sor mngon par shes so //
translated: He knows the feeling that arises from tongue contact, body contact, and mind contact.

original: dge slong tshor ba mngon sum du byas pa de tshor ba de dag nyid shin tu rgyas par rtog ste /
analyzed: dge slong tshor ba mngon sum du byas pa de tshor ba de dag nyid shin tu rgyas par rtog ste /
translated: “Monks, when you have actualized feeling, you should investigate those feelings in detail.

original: de mig gi reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba skye ba na skyes pa la gnas shing myong bar byed la 'gags shing 'gag pa na @217a *//
analyzed: de mig gi reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba skye ba na skyes pa la gnas shing myong bar byed la 'gags shing 'gag pa na @217a *//
translated: When the feeling that arises from eye contact arises, you should know that it has arisen and you should experience it. When it ceases,

original: bdag gi tshor ba 'gags so zhes so sor mngon par shes so //
analyzed: bdag gi tshor ba 'gags so zhes so sor mngon par shes so //
translated: you should know that ‘My feeling has ceased.’

original: gzhan yang / rna ba'i reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba so sor mngon par shes te /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rna ba'i reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba so sor mngon par shes te /
translated: “You should know the feeling that arises from ear contact.

original: gang bdag gi mig gi reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba de 'gags shing nub la med par 'gyur te yang mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang bdag gi mig gi reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba de 'gags shing nub la med par 'gyur te yang mi 'byung ngo //
translated: The feeling that arises from contact with the eye has ceased, disappeared, and is no more.

original: de dag 'gags nas gzhan yang rna ba'i reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba skyes pa bde ba 'di bde ba la dmigs pas sdug bsngal ma yin /
analyzed: de dag 'gags nas gzhan yang rna ba'i reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba skyes pa bde ba 'di bde ba la dmigs pas sdug bsngal ma yin /
translated: When that has ceased, another feeling arises, a feeling that arises from contact with the ear, pleasant, and so on up to:

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal la dmigs pas bde ba ma yin zhing sdug bsngal ma yin no snyam mo //
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal la dmigs pas bde ba ma yin zhing sdug bsngal ma yin no snyam mo //
translated: not painful, not unpleasant.

original: de rna ba'i reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba ji lta ba bzhin rjes su mthong zhing rnam par shes nas /
analyzed: de rna ba'i reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba ji lta ba bzhin rjes su mthong zhing rnam par shes nas /
translated: He sees and knows the feeling that arises from contact with the ear as it really is.

original: rna ba dang 'brel ba'i tshor ba dag la kun tu chags pa med la de tshor ba myong ba na 'dod chags dang bral te /
analyzed: rna ba dang 'brel ba'i tshor ba dag la kun tu chags pa med la de tshor ba myong ba na 'dod chags dang bral te /
translated: He is not attached to the feelings associated with the ear, and when he experiences a feeling, he is free from attachment,

original: rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and is liberated.

original: rna ba'i reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba de 'gags na sna'i dmigs pa'i tshor ba skye ste /
analyzed: rna ba'i reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba de 'gags na sna'i dmigs pa'i tshor ba skye ste /
translated: When the feeling that arises from contact with the ear has ceased, a feeling arises that has the nose as its object.

original: de snas kun nas bslang ba snas kun nas so sor myong bar byed de /
analyzed: de snas kun nas bslang ba snas kun nas so sor myong bar byed de /
translated: It is produced by the nose, and experienced by the nose.

original: bdag sna'i reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba skyes pa bde ba la dmigs pa ni bde ba'o //
analyzed: bdag sna'i reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba skyes pa bde ba la dmigs pa ni bde ba'o //
translated: “When a pleasant feeling arises from contact with the nose, I focus on that pleasant feeling.

original: sdug bsngal la dmigs pa ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la dmigs pa ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: When an unpleasant feeling arises, I focus on that unpleasant feeling.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba'ang ma yin pa la dmigs pa ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba'ang ma yin no snyam mo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba'ang ma yin pa la dmigs pa ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba'ang ma yin no snyam mo //
translated: When a feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant arises, I focus on that feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: de sna'i dmigs pa'i tshor ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin so sor myong bar @217b byed de /
analyzed: de sna'i dmigs pa'i tshor ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin so sor myong bar @217b byed de /
translated: I experience the feeling that is the object of the nose just as it is.

original: nub pa'ang so sor myong bar byed do //
analyzed: nub pa'ang so sor myong bar byed do //
translated: I experience the feeling that is the object of the nose when it ceases.

original: de 'gags na sna'i dmigs pa'i tshor ba bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba'ang ma yin pa skye ste /
analyzed: de 'gags na sna'i dmigs pa'i tshor ba bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba'ang ma yin pa skye ste /
translated: When it ceases, a pleasant feeling arises that is the object of the nose, an unpleasant feeling arises, and a feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant arises.

original: de so sor myong bar byed do //
analyzed: de so sor myong bar byed do //
translated: I experience that.

original: bdag gi sna'i dmigs pa'i tshor ba skye ste /
analyzed: bdag gi sna'i dmigs pa'i tshor ba skye ste /
translated: The feeling that is the object of the nose arises for me.

original: ji ltar lhag par chags pa skyes pa de ltar bdag gi 'gog pa 'di dag kyang skye ste /
analyzed: ji ltar lhag par chags pa skyes pa de ltar bdag gi 'gog pa 'di dag kyang skye ste /
translated: Just as the attachment increases, so also the cessation of the self increases.

original: de 'gags na lce'i dmigs pa'i tshor ba rnam pa gsum skye ba nas yid kyi dmigs pa'i tshor ba rnam pa gsum snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de 'gags na lce'i dmigs pa'i tshor ba rnam pa gsum skye ba nas yid kyi dmigs pa'i tshor ba rnam pa gsum snga ma bzhin no //
translated: When that ceases, the three kinds of feeling that have the tongue as their object arise, and so on up to: the three kinds of feeling that have the mind as their object arise, as before.

original: de sa gzhan bzhi pa la tshor ba yang dag par rgya che ba la 'jug ste /
analyzed: de sa gzhan bzhi pa la tshor ba yang dag par rgya che ba la 'jug ste /
translated: He enters into the vastness of feeling in the fourth stage.

original: de'i brtson 'grus brtsams pa spro ba chen po bdud kyi 'ching ba gcod par 'dod pa la sa bla'i gnod sbyin shin tu dga' nas bar snang gi gnod sbyin rnams la mngon par bsnyad do //
analyzed: de'i brtson 'grus brtsams pa spro ba chen po bdud kyi 'ching ba gcod par 'dod pa la sa bla'i gnod sbyin shin tu dga' nas bar snang gi gnod sbyin rnams la mngon par bsnyad do //
translated: When he begins his effort, the earth-dwelling yakshas become very joyful and proclaim it to the sky-dwelling yakshas.

original: de dag gis kyang rgyal po chen po bzhi la mngon par bsnyad do //
analyzed: de dag gis kyang rgyal po chen po bzhi la mngon par bsnyad do //
translated: They proclaim it to the Four Great Kings.

original: de dag gis kyang rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams la mngon par bsnyad do //
analyzed: de dag gis kyang rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams la mngon par bsnyad do //
translated: They proclaim it to the gods of the Four Great Kings.

original: de dag gis kyang lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin la mngon par bsnyad do //
analyzed: de dag gis kyang lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin la mngon par bsnyad do //
translated: They proclaim it to Sakra, Lord of the Gods.

original: brgya byin gyis kyang 'thab bral gyi lha rnams la mngon par bsnyad do //
analyzed: brgya byin gyis kyang 'thab bral gyi lha rnams la mngon par bsnyad do //
translated: Śakra will then proclaim to the gods of the Heaven Free from Strife:

original: gang dzambu'i gling na rigs kyi bu yul che ge mo zhig dang / grong mang ge mo zhig dang / rigs ga ge mo zhig las rigs kyi bu che ge mo zhes bya ba skra dang / kha spu bregs te /
analyzed: gang dzambu'i gling na rigs kyi bu yul che ge mo zhig dang / grong mang ge mo zhig dang / rigs ga ge mo zhig las rigs kyi bu che ge mo zhes bya ba skra dang / kha spu bregs te /
translated: ‘In Jambudvīpa, a son of noble family from such and such a country, such and such a town, and such and such a family, has shaved off his hair and beard,

original: gos ngur smrig bogs nas dad pas khyim nas khyim med par rab tu byung ste /
analyzed: gos ngur smrig bogs nas dad pas khyim nas khyim med par rab tu byung ste /
translated: and with faith, he has left home for homelessness, wearing saffron robes.

original: de 'bad pa dang / brtson pa'i rim gyis sa gzhan bzhi pa'i tshor ba yang dag par rgya @218a *//
analyzed: de 'bad pa dang / brtson pa'i rim gyis sa gzhan bzhi pa'i tshor ba yang dag par rgya @218a *//
translated: Through the stages of striving and diligence, he has entered the vast experience of the fourth ground.🔽He is bringing down the side of the māras and raising up the side of the sacred Dharma. I will proclaim this to my gods.’

original: che ba la zhugs pa bdud kyi phyogs ni dma' bar byed cing yang dag pa dam pa'i chos kyi phyogs ni mngon par mtho bar byed pa de bdag gi lha rnams la bsnyad do snyam mo; ;brgya byin glang po'i che sa srung gi bu la zhon pa de
analyzed: che ba la zhugs pa bdud kyi phyogs ni dma' bar byed cing yang dag pa dam pa'i chos kyi phyogs ni mngon par mtho bar byed pa de bdag gi lha rnams la bsnyad do snyam mo; ;brgya byin glang po'i che sa srung gi bu la zhon pa de
translated: Śakra will then mount Airāvaṇa, the son of the elephant king,

original: 'thab bral gyi lha dag gis mthong nas dga' ste brgya byin la smras pa /
analyzed: 'thab bral gyi lha dag gis mthong nas dga' ste brgya byin la smras pa /
translated: The gods of the Heaven Free from Strife see this and are delighted. They say to Śakra:

original: brgya byin / gang dzambu'i gling gi mi chos dang ldan zhing chos kyi rjes su 'jug pa de /
analyzed: brgya byin / gang dzambu'i gling gi mi chos dang ldan zhing chos kyi rjes su 'jug pa de /
translated: “Śakra, the people of Jambudvīpa are righteous and follow the Dharma.

original: brgya byin / khyod kyi dam pa'i chos dang mthun par gyur pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: brgya byin / khyod kyi dam pa'i chos dang mthun par gyur pa nyid yin no //
translated: Śakra, this is in accord with your Dharma.”

original: gzhan yang / dge slong de bdud kyi 'ching ba spong zhing rab tu spong ba'i tshor ba la ji ltar rtog ce na /🔽rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang / dge slong de bdud kyi 'ching ba spong zhing rab tu spong ba'i tshor ba la ji ltar rtog ce na / rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa'am /
translated: Moreover, how does that monk investigate the feelings that abandon and completely abandon the bonds of Māra?

original: lha'i mig gis brtags na /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis brtags na /
translated: The spiritual practitioner who carefully observes the inner phenomena sees with knowledge derived from hearing or through the divine eye:

original: dge slong de yang dag pa'i tshor ba nyid la 'di ltar rnam par rtog par byed de /
analyzed: dge slong de yang dag pa'i tshor ba nyid la 'di ltar rnam par rtog par byed de /
translated: “When a monk who has the correct view investigates the bonds of Māra, he thinks as follows:

original: de mig gi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa mi dge ba skyes pa de langs pa na dge ba la dmigs pa gnyis pas 'gags so //
analyzed: de mig gi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa mi dge ba skyes pa de langs pa na dge ba la dmigs pa gnyis pas 'gags so //
translated: ‘When the arising of an unwholesome object of the eye consciousness is stopped by the arising of a second wholesome object,

original: dge ba skyes pa de'ang lung du ma bstan pa la dmigs pas 'gags shing lung du bstan pa'ang 'gags la lung du ma bstan pa skyes so //
analyzed: dge ba skyes pa de'ang lung du ma bstan pa la dmigs pas 'gags shing lung du bstan pa'ang 'gags la lung du ma bstan pa skyes so //
translated: And since that arisen virtue is focused on the indeterminate, it ceases, and the determinate ceases, and the indeterminate arises.

original: de bzhin du rna ba'i reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / sna'i re ga pa las byung ba'i tshor pa dang / lce'i reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / lus dang / yid kyi reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba so sor myong bar byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba'i reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / sna'i re ga pa las byung ba'i tshor pa dang / lce'i reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / lus dang / yid kyi reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba so sor myong bar byed do //
translated: In the same way, he experiences the feeling that arises from contact with the ear, the feeling that arises from contact with the nose, the feeling that arises from contact with the tongue, the feeling that arises from contact with the body, and the feeling that arises from contact with the mind.

original: so sor myong bar byed pa na dge ba'i chos rnams yongs su @218b rdzogs par 'gyur zhing de'i nyon mongs pa bsrabs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: so sor myong bar byed pa na dge ba'i chos rnams yongs su @218b rdzogs par 'gyur zhing de'i nyon mongs pa bsrabs par 'gyur ro //
translated: When he experiences them, his virtuous qualities are perfected, and his afflictions are reduced.

original: de de ltar sgom pa na tshor ba phra mo de dag so sor shes so //
analyzed: de de ltar sgom pa na tshor ba phra mo de dag so sor shes so //
translated: When he meditates in this way, he understands those subtle feelings individually.

original: de chos kyi tshor ba dang / lhan cig 'gag pa mthang ste /
analyzed: de chos kyi tshor ba dang / lhan cig 'gag pa mthang ste /
translated: He sees the cessation of those two feelings together with the feeling of the Dharma.

original: ji ltar na mar me'i 'od nyi ma'i 'od kyis 'gag pa de bzhin du tshor ba gnyis ka 'gag go /
analyzed: ji ltar na mar me'i 'od nyi ma'i 'od kyis 'gag pa de bzhin du tshor ba gnyis ka 'gag go /
translated: Just as the light of a lamp is extinguished by the light of the sun, so those two feelings cease.

original: gzhan yang / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i tshor ba rgyas pa so sor myong bar byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i tshor ba rgyas pa so sor myong bar byed de /
translated: Moreover, he experiences the expansion of virtuous and non-virtuous feelings.

original: dper na / mar me'i 'od la mar me'i 'od gnyis pas gsal bar byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na / mar me'i 'od la mar me'i 'od gnyis pas gsal bar byed pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the light of a lamp being illuminated by a second light of a lamp.

original: gzhan yang / tshor ba rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang / tshor ba rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed de /
translated: Moreover, he discerns feelings.

original: tshor ba gang zhig dang / tshor ba gzhan gang zhig gi tshor ba dang lhan cig gtan du mi mthun par 'gyur ram snyam pa las dge ba'i tshor ba dang / mi dge ba'i tshor ba lhan cig gtan du mi mthun par mthong ste /
analyzed: tshor ba gang zhig dang / tshor ba gzhan gang zhig gi tshor ba dang lhan cig gtan du mi mthun par 'gyur ram snyam pa las dge ba'i tshor ba dang / mi dge ba'i tshor ba lhan cig gtan du mi mthun par mthong ste /
translated: He thinks, “Which feeling and which other feeling are incompatible with each other?” He sees that virtuous feelings and non-virtuous feelings are incompatible with each other.

original: dper na / mar me'i 'od dang / skar ma'i 'od lhan cig mi mthun pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na / mar me'i 'od dang / skar ma'i 'od lhan cig mi mthun pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the light of a lamp and the light of a star being incompatible with each other.

original: gzhan yang / dge slong de rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang / dge slong de rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed de /
translated: Moreover, that monk discerns:

original: tshor ba gang zhig la tshor ba gang zhig gis gtan du sel bar byed ce na /
analyzed: tshor ba gang zhig la tshor ba gang zhig gis gtan du sel bar byed ce na /
translated: “Which feeling is completely eliminated by which feeling?”

original: de zag pa med pa la dmigs pa'i tshor bas zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa'i tshor ba la gtan sel ba nyid du mthong ste /
analyzed: de zag pa med pa la dmigs pa'i tshor bas zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa'i tshor ba la gtan sel ba nyid du mthong ste /
translated: He sees that the feeling that is focused on the uncontaminated state is the one that completely eliminates the feeling that is focused on the contaminated state.

original: dper na / me'i 'od kyis kha ba zhu ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na / me'i 'od kyis kha ba zhu ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the light of a fire melting snow.🔽He thinks, “Which feeling is harmed by which feeling?”

original: tshor ba gang zhig la tshor ba gang zhig gis gnod zhig gu snyam nas yang 'di rgyas par byed de /
analyzed: tshor ba gang zhig la tshor ba gang zhig gis gnod zhig gu snyam nas yang 'di rgyas par byed de /
translated: He then elaborates on this:

original: gang gi tshe mi bde ba'i tshor ba la bde ba'i tshor bas zil gyis gnon par mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe mi bde ba'i tshor ba la bde ba'i tshor bas zil gyis gnon par mthong ngo //
translated: “When he sees that the feeling of pleasure overwhelms the feeling of pain,

original: de'ang rgyas par byed de /🔽dper na / nyi mas nyin mo'i zla ba @219a *//
analyzed: de'ang rgyas par byed de / dper na / nyi mas nyin mo'i zla ba @219a *//
translated: he then elaborates on this:🔽“For example, it is like the light of the sun overwhelming the light of the moon

original: ba'i 'od zil gyis gnon par 'gyur zhing zla ba'i 'od de'ang mtshan mo rgyas par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ba'i 'od zil gyis gnon par 'gyur zhing zla ba'i 'od de'ang mtshan mo rgyas par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: during the day, and the light of the moon overwhelming the light of the sun at night.

original: de nas gzhan yang /
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang /
translated: “Next,

original: dge slong de tshor ba rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed de /
analyzed: dge slong de tshor ba rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed de /
translated: that monk discerns feelings.

original: gang tshor ba mang po dang ldan pa dag tshor ba gcig gi dran pa rtse gcig pa'i tshor ba dang lhan cig mi mthun pa zil gyis gnon par 'gyur ram snyam na /
analyzed: gang tshor ba mang po dang ldan pa dag tshor ba gcig gi dran pa rtse gcig pa'i tshor ba dang lhan cig mi mthun pa zil gyis gnon par 'gyur ram snyam na /
translated: If he thinks, “Those who have many feelings will not be able to overcome the many feelings that are incompatible with the single-pointed mindfulness of one feeling,”

original: de 'jig rten pa byed pa'i tshor ba mang po dag 'jig rten las 'das pa zag pa med pa'i tshor bas zil gyis gnon par mthong ste /
analyzed: de 'jig rten pa byed pa'i tshor ba mang po dag 'jig rten las 'das pa zag pa med pa'i tshor bas zil gyis gnon par mthong ste /
translated: he will see that the many worldly feelings that are created are overcome by the single feeling of the transcendent state that is free of defilements.

original: dper na / mtshan mo rgyu skar dang / gza' dang / skar ma mang po'i 'od dag zla ba'i 'od gcig gis gnon pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na / mtshan mo rgyu skar dang / gza' dang / skar ma mang po'i 'od dag zla ba'i 'od gcig gis gnon pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, just as the light of the many stars, planets, and constellations is overcome by the single light of the moon.

original: gzhan yang / dge slong de tshor ba rjes su mthong ba'i tshor ba ches phra ba la rtog par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang / dge slong de tshor ba rjes su mthong ba'i tshor ba ches phra ba la rtog par byed de /
translated: “Moreover, that monk who sees feelings will contemplate the most subtle feelings.

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang; lce dang / lus kyis kun nas bslang ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i tshor ba mang ba ni gang yin /
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang; lce dang / lus kyis kun nas bslang ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i tshor ba mang ba ni gang yin /
translated: What are the many contaminated feelings that are motivated by the eyes, ears, nose, tongue, and body?

original: dge ba ni ji ltar rtsom zhig gu snyam na de 'jig rten pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i tshor ba mang ba'ang zag pa med pa snang bas thub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge ba ni ji ltar rtsom zhig gu snyam na de 'jig rten pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i tshor ba mang ba'ang zag pa med pa snang bas thub par 'gyur te /
translated: The many contaminated feelings of worldly beings are overcome by the light of the uncontaminated.

original: dper na / mtshan mo rgyu skar dang / gza' dang / skar ma rnams kyi 'od zla ba'i snang ba gnas pas thub pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na / mtshan mo rgyu skar dang / gza' dang / skar ma rnams kyi 'od zla ba'i snang ba gnas pas thub pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the light of the stars, planets, and other heavenly bodies is overcome by the light of the moon.

original: de nas gzhan yang /🔽dge slong de tshor ba de la rtag ste bdag gi tshor ba gzhan yun ji srid gcig tu gnas snyam mo //
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang / dge slong de tshor ba de la rtag ste bdag gi tshor ba gzhan yun ji srid gcig tu gnas snyam mo //
translated: “Moreover,🔽the monk will contemplate the impermanence of feelings, wondering, ‘How long will my feelings remain?’

original: de skad cig la bdag gi tshor ba gzhan skye zhing 'jig par gnas @219b par mthong ste /
analyzed: de skad cig la bdag gi tshor ba gzhan skye zhing 'jig par gnas @219b par mthong ste /
translated: He will see that they arise and cease in an instant.

original: dper na / glog bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na / glog bzhin no //
translated: For example, they are like lightning.

original: gzhan yang / dge slong de 'di ltar rab tu rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang / dge slong de 'di ltar rab tu rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: “Moreover, the monk will contemplate in the following manner:

original: ci mig gi tshor ba sna'i tshor ba'i rkyen du 'gyur ram snyam mo //
analyzed: ci mig gi tshor ba sna'i tshor ba'i rkyen du 'gyur ram snyam mo //
translated: ‘Can the feeling of the eye become the condition for the feeling of the nose?’

original: de blo gcig bzhin du dbang po tha dad pa'i dmigs pa'i tshor ba dbang po de dag thams cad kyis mthong ste /
analyzed: de blo gcig bzhin du dbang po tha dad pa'i dmigs pa'i tshor ba dbang po de dag thams cad kyis mthong ste /
translated: The mind is like a single sense faculty, and all the sense faculties see the object of the sense faculty that experiences it.

original: dper na / ba lang gcig cig rta dang / rnga mo dang / bong bu dang / ma he'i rigs tha dad pa rnams kyi rkyen du mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du thog ma med pa nas brtson pa'i dbang po lngas kun nas bslang ba'i yul gyi bye brag tha dad pa'i dbang po rnams kyi dmigs pa ni gcig tu mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dper na / ba lang gcig cig rta dang / rnga mo dang / bong bu dang / ma he'i rigs tha dad pa rnams kyi rkyen du mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du thog ma med pa nas brtson pa'i dbang po lngas kun nas bslang ba'i yul gyi bye brag tha dad pa'i dbang po rnams kyi dmigs pa ni gcig tu mi 'gyur te /
translated: For example, a single cow is not the condition for the different types of horses, camels, donkeys, and buffalo. In the same way, the different sense faculties, which are the specific objects that are produced by the five sense faculties that have been practiced since beginningless time, do not become a single thing.

original: dper na / blang dang; rta dang / rnga mo dang / bong bu dang / ma he dang / phag bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na / blang dang; rta dang / rnga mo dang / bong bu dang / ma he dang / phag bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like a cow, a horse, a camel, a donkey, a buffalo, and a pig.

original: de ltar tshor ba rjes su mthong ba'i dge slong de dag ni shes pa ches zhib pa skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar tshor ba rjes su mthong ba'i dge slong de dag ni shes pa ches zhib pa skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: “In this way, the monk who sees feelings will develop a very subtle understanding.

original: de shes pa de la kun tu bsten cing skom ste mang du byed do //
analyzed: de shes pa de la kun tu bsten cing skom ste mang du byed do //
translated: He will rely on that understanding, be thirsty for it, and do much of it.

original: de kun tu bsten pa na tshor ba rjes su mthong zhing zad pa dang / 'jig pa rjes su mthong nas 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de kun tu bsten pa na tshor ba rjes su mthong zhing zad pa dang / 'jig pa rjes su mthong nas 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: When he attends to them, he sees that they cease and disintegrate. He thinks:

original: bdag gi mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang; lus dang / yid kyis kun nas bslang ba'i tshor ba gang nas 'ong zhing gang du song /
analyzed: bdag gi mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang; lus dang / yid kyis kun nas bslang ba'i tshor ba gang nas 'ong zhing gang du song /
translated: “Where do the feelings that arise from the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind come from, and where do they go?

original: 'gag pa na gang du gsog par 'gyur snyam mo //
analyzed: 'gag pa na gang du gsog par 'gyur snyam mo //
translated: When they cease, where do they accumulate?”

original: dge slong tshor ba zad pa dang / 'jig pa rjes su mthong ba de rab tu sems pa na /
analyzed: dge slong tshor ba zad pa dang / 'jig pa rjes su mthong ba de rab tu sems pa na /
translated: “When the monk sees the cessation and disintegration of feelings, he thinks:

original: lam gyi rnam pa la 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa la 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: ‘The path is like this:

original: mig gi tshor ba gang nas kyang skye ba med cing 'ong ba med la /
analyzed: mig gi tshor ba gang nas kyang skye ba med cing 'ong ba med la /
translated: Eye-contact is not produced from anywhere and does not go anywhere.

original: 'gag pa na'ang gang du'ang gsog par mi 'gyur te @220a *//
analyzed: 'gag pa na'ang gang du'ang gsog par mi 'gyur te @220a *//
translated: When it ceases, it does not accumulate anywhere.

original: gang nas kyang skye ba med cing 'ong ba med la /
analyzed: gang nas kyang skye ba med cing 'ong ba med la /
translated: It is not produced from anywhere and does not go anywhere.

original: 'gag pa na'ang gang du'ang gsog par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gag pa na'ang gang du'ang gsog par mi 'gyur te /
translated: When it ceases, it does not accumulate anywhere.

original: mig gi tshor ba ma byung ba las 'byung zhing /
analyzed: mig gi tshor ba ma byung ba las 'byung zhing /
translated: Eye-contact arises from what has not arisen.

original: byung nas kyang so sor 'bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byung nas kyang so sor 'bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and when they arise, they arise separately.

original: mig gi 'byung khung las tshor ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: mig gi 'byung khung las tshor ba 'byung ste /
translated: “The source of eye-contact is feeling.

original: dper na / rgya mtsho'i gzhi las chu 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na / rgya mtsho'i gzhi las chu 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the ocean, the source of water.

original: 'gag pa na'ang gang du'ang mi gsog ste /
analyzed: 'gag pa na'ang gang du'ang mi gsog ste /
translated: When it ceases, it does not accumulate anywhere.

original: dper na / chu bo gzhol bar 'gro ba rgya mtshor 'du ba bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na / chu bo gzhol bar 'gro ba rgya mtshor 'du ba bzhin te /
translated: It is like a river flowing into the ocean.

original: mig gi tshor pa ma byung ba las 'byung zhing byung nas kyang so sor 'jig par 'gyur ro snyam mo //
analyzed: mig gi tshor pa ma byung ba las 'byung zhing byung nas kyang so sor 'jig par 'gyur ro snyam mo //
translated: Eye-contact arises from the non-arisen, and when it arises, it dissolves again.”

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang; lus dang / yid kyi tshor ba dag ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang; lus dang / yid kyi tshor ba dag ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin te /
translated: “The feelings of the eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind arise interdependently.

original: dper na / rdza mkhan nam /🔽rdza mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhig 'khor lo la'ang brten /
analyzed: dper na / rdza mkhan nam / rdza mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhig 'khor lo la'ang brten /
translated: It is like a potter🔽or a skilled potter’s apprentice who, in dependence on a wheel,

original: 'jim pa la'ang brten; rtsol ba la'ang brten /
analyzed: 'jim pa la'ang brten; rtsol ba la'ang brten /
translated: clay,

original: chu la'ang brten nas rgyu 'jim pa la brten pa'i bum pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: chu la'ang brten nas rgyu 'jim pa la brten pa'i bum pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: and water, produces a pot from the clay.

original: bum pa de 'byung khung gnang nas kyang ma 'ongs shing 'jig pa na'ang gang du'ang gsog par mi 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: bum pa de 'byung khung gnang nas kyang ma 'ongs shing 'jig pa na'ang gang du'ang gsog par mi 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: Although the vase does not come from any source and when it is destroyed it does not accumulate anywhere,🔽the vase arises from causes and conditions.

original: rgyu rkyen las bum pa 'byung ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: rgyu rkyen las bum pa 'byung ba de bzhin du /
translated: Likewise,

original: mig la'ang brten /
analyzed: mig la'ang brten /
translated: in dependence on the eye,

original: gzugs la'ang brten /🔽rna ba la'ang brten /
analyzed: gzugs la'ang brten / rna ba la'ang brten /
translated: in dependence on form,🔽in dependence on the ear,

original: sna la'ang brten /
analyzed: sna la'ang brten /
translated: in dependence on the nose,

original: nam mkha' la'ang brten /
analyzed: nam mkha' la'ang brten /
translated: in dependence on space,

original: yid la byed pa la'ang brten nas /
analyzed: yid la byed pa la'ang brten nas /
translated: and in dependence on mental activity,

original: mig gi tshor ba bde ba'am /
analyzed: mig gi tshor ba bde ba'am /
translated: a feeling of pleasure,

original: sdug bsngal lam /
analyzed: sdug bsngal lam /

analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba'ang ma yin pa skye'o //

original: dper na / bum pa gal te @220b rgyu rkyen bzang po las byung na bum pa de legs par 'gyur zhing gal te ngan na de'i tshe bum pa ma legs par 'gyur ba de bzhin du gal te dmigs pa'i rgyu dang / rkyen bzang na de'i tshe mig la sogs pa tshor ba bzang po skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dper na / bum pa gal te @220b rgyu rkyen bzang po las byung na bum pa de legs par 'gyur zhing gal te ngan na de'i tshe bum pa ma legs par 'gyur ba de bzhin du gal te dmigs pa'i rgyu dang / rkyen bzang na de'i tshe mig la sogs pa tshor ba bzang po skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Likewise, if the causes and conditions of observation are good, then at that time a good feeling will arise in the eye and so on.

original: chos dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i rim gyis mya ngan las 'das par 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i rim gyis mya ngan las 'das par 'gro bar 'gyur ro //

original: gal te rgyu dang / rkyen mi bzang de'i tshe mig la sogs pa'i tshor ba ngan pa skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang / rkyen mi bzang de'i tshe mig la sogs pa'i tshor ba ngan pa skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: “ ‘If the causes and conditions are not good, then unpleasant sensations will arise in the eyes and so forth.

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug la dmigs pa 'khor ba na sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug la dmigs pa 'khor ba na sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ro //

original: las dang / 'bras bur 'brel ba thams cad la mkhas par sems pa'i dge slong ni tshor ba rjes su tshor ba na tshor ba du ma la gnas par mthong ste /
analyzed: las dang / 'bras bur 'brel ba thams cad la mkhas par sems pa'i dge slong ni tshor ba rjes su tshor ba na tshor ba du ma la gnas par mthong ste /

original: byed pa pos gnas su ma byas shing rgyu med pa las kyang ma byung la 'dod rgyal gyis kyang ma byas /
analyzed: byed pa pos gnas su ma byas shing rgyu med pa las kyang ma byung la 'dod rgyal gyis kyang ma byas /
translated: He will see that they are not created by an agent, that they do not arise without causes, and that they are not created by chance.

original: ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin /
analyzed: ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin /

original: rtag pa ma yin /🔽brtan pa ma yin /

original: ther zug ma yin /
analyzed: ther zug ma yin /

original: yongs su 'gyur ba'i chos can yin zhing /
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba'i chos can yin zhing /

original: de'i tshor ba'i phung po de mthong nas yang 'byung ba'i sred pa dga' ba'i 'dod chags kyi mod la skyes pa'i dri ma can yongs su nyams par byed de /

original: 'khor ba thams cad mi rtag par rjes su mthong ba'i dge slong ni lam kun tu sten par byed cing goms par byed la mang du byed do //🔽de de ltar sgom pa na kun tu sbyor ba dag spong bar byed cing bag la nyal 'dor bar byed de /

original: kun tu sbyor @221a *//
analyzed: kun tu sbyor @221a *//

original: ba dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: ba dag gang zhe na /

original: rjes su chags pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang / khong khro ba'i kun tu sbyor ba dang / nga rgyal gyi kun tu sbyor ba dang / ma rig pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang lta ba'i kun tu sbyor ba dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang /

analyzed: the tshom gyi kun tu sbyor ba dang / phrag dog gi kun tu sbyor ba dang / ser sna'i kun tu sbyor ba ste /

original: kun tu sbyor ba de dag spong bar byed do //
analyzed: kun tu sbyor ba de dag spong bar byed do //

original: pag la nyal gang zhe na /
analyzed: pag la nyal gang zhe na /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: 'dod pa 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal dang / srid pa'i 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal dang / lta ba'i bag la nyal dang / khong khro ba'i bag la nyal dang / ma rig pa'i bag la nyal dang / nga rgyal gyi bag la nyal dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal dang / srid pa'i 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal dang / lta ba'i bag la nyal dang / khong khro ba'i bag la nyal dang / ma rig pa'i bag la nyal dang / nga rgyal gyi bag la nyal dang /
translated: the latent tendency of desire-attachment, the latent tendency of existence-attachment, the latent tendency of views, the latent tendency of anger, the latent tendency of ignorance, the latent tendency of pride,

original: the tshom gyi bag la nyal te /
analyzed: the tshom gyi bag la nyal te /
translated: and the latent tendency of doubt.

analyzed: 'di dag ni gtso bo ji lta ba bzhin du srid pa gsum du yongs su 'jug par byed pa /

original: dus gsum gyi rjes su 'gro ba /
analyzed: dus gsum gyi rjes su 'gro ba /

analyzed: bar ma gsum gyi tshor ba gsum rjes su bsgoms pa /

original: skye ba gsum du 'pho bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba gsum du 'pho bar byed pa ste /

original: 'khor ba'i rgyur gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgyur gyur pa yin no //

original: de nas gzhan yang /
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

analyzed: ji ltar dge slong de rgyu dang / rkyen du bcas pa 'di dag khong du chud par 'gyur /

original: mig gi rkyen ni gang /
analyzed: mig gi rkyen ni gang /

original: rgyu ni gang las skyes /🔽gzhi gang la lta bar byed cig gu snyam nas rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi chos la chos kyi rje su lta zhing gnas pa des thos pa las @221b byung ba'i shes pa'am /

original: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / bsdug bsngal ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams yod cing 'byung bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong de tshor ba'i rgyu dang / rkyen mthong ba /

translated: If he sees the transformation of the mind, he will again make progress on that very object, and he will make an effort, strive, and make the mind workable. He will make the mind familiar with the virtuous dharmas that are free from fluxes.

translated: If he sees that the mind is affected by the feeling that arises in relation to taste, then he again binds the mind with the rope of attention to the object-post, thinking, “How can I make this mind, along with the tongue’s feeling and craving, unperturbed?”

translated: The monk who sees the arising and cessation of the six objects and the feelings in the body enters the fifth stage.🔽He thinks, “What are these feelings that experience feeling?

analyzed: de yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i tshor ba 'di ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin te /

original: pa'i mes bsregs te /
analyzed: pa'i mes bsregs te /

analyzed: 'di la tshor ba po dang / byed pa po ni gang yang med kyi /

analyzed: rgyu rkyen dang 'brel ba'i 'du byed kyi phung po 'di nyid skye /

analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po 'di nyid 'gag go snyam mo //
translated: “This very aggregate of formation will cease.”

original: de mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba ji lta ba bzhin rjes su mthong zhing rjes su 'jug pa des sems mi 'phrogs shing rnam par mi g-yo la skyon du 'gyur bar mi byed de /

translated: “When he sees and engages with the sensations that arise from the contact of the eye in this way, his mind is not carried away and does not waver, and he does not allow it to become flawed.

original: dri ma can du mi byed do //
analyzed: dri ma can du mi byed do //
translated: He does not make it impure.

analyzed: yang dge slong de rna ba'i tshor ba la rtog par byed de /

analyzed: tshor ba rjes su myong zhing reg pa'i tshor ba 'di gang yin snyam mo //
translated: ‘What is the sensation that is experienced through contact?’

analyzed: de rna ba'i tshor ba 'di yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang shin tu 'brel bar mthong ste /
translated: He sees that the sensations of the ear are closely related to the mind consciousness.

analyzed: yid dang shin tu 'brel ba de la gnas par zad kyi /
translated: They are simply present in relation to the mind.

analyzed: 'di la byed pa po dang / tshor ba po med cing rna ba'i tshor ba rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la byed pa po dang / tshor ba po med de /
translated: There is no agent or experiencer in this, and the sensations of the ear arise in dependence on conditions. There is no agent or experiencer.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po stong pa 'di rgyu rkyen gyi dbang gis skye zhing 'gag go snyam mo //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po stong pa 'di rgyu rkyen gyi dbang gis skye zhing 'gag go snyam mo //
translated: This aggregate of formation is empty. It arises and ceases due to the power of causes and conditions.🔽“

original: yang dge slong de sna'i tshor ba la rtog par byed de /
analyzed: yang dge slong de sna'i tshor ba la rtog par byed de /
translated: ‘The monk also examines the sensations of the nose.

original: tshor ba 'di myong zhing rig pa gang zhig yin snyam mo //
analyzed: tshor ba 'di myong zhing rig pa gang zhig yin snyam mo //
translated: What is it that experiences and knows these sensations?’

original: de tshor ba yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang shin tu 'brel bar mthong ste /
analyzed: de tshor ba yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang shin tu 'brel bar mthong ste /
translated: He sees that these sensations are closely related to the mental consciousness.

original: de la dmigs pa de la gnas pa de rgyu dang / rkyen las byung zhing rjes su myong ba'i mtshan nyid yin gyi 'du byed kyi phung po stong pa 'di byed pa pos gnas su ma byas shing tshor ba pos gnas su ma byas pa rgyun chags par 'jug pa @225b yin no snyam ste /

translated: They arise from causes and conditions and have the characteristic of being experienced. This aggregate of formation is empty. It is not created by an agent, nor is it created by a feeler. It is a continuous process.’

original: de sna'i tshor ba rtogs nas byed pa po dang / tshor ba po med cing don gyi bar du gcod par gyur pa ni med do snyam mo //
analyzed: de sna'i tshor ba rtogs nas byed pa po dang / tshor ba po med cing don gyi bar du gcod par gyur pa ni med do snyam mo //
translated: Thus, having understood the sensations of the nose, he thinks, ‘There is no agent or feeler. There is no obstruction to the object.’🔽“

original: yang dge slong de lce'i tshor ba la rnam par rtog ste /
analyzed: yang dge slong de lce'i tshor ba la rnam par rtog ste /
translated: ‘The monk also examines the sensations of the tongue.

original: lce'i tshor ba 'di myong zhing rig pa gang yin snyam mo //
analyzed: lce'i tshor ba 'di myong zhing rig pa gang yin snyam mo //
translated: What is it that experiences and is aware of the sensations of the tongue?

original: de lce'i tshor ba 'di yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang shin tu 'brel bar mthong ste /🔽de la gnas pa de dang 'brel ba de la dmigs pa de'i rgyu las byung zhing /
analyzed: de lce'i tshor ba 'di yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang shin tu 'brel bar mthong ste / de la gnas pa de dang 'brel ba de la dmigs pa de'i rgyu las byung zhing /
translated: He sees that the sensations of the tongue are closely related to the mental consciousness.

original: de la bsten pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de la bsten pa yin gyi /
translated: They are based on it, related to it, and focus on it. They arise from its causes and depend on it.

original: 'di la byed pa po dang / tshor ba po dang / don gyi bar du gcod par gyur pa med de /
analyzed: 'di la byed pa po dang / tshor ba po dang / don gyi bar du gcod par gyur pa med de /
translated: But there is no agent, no experiencer, and no obstruction to the object.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po stong pa 'di'i rgyu dang / rkyen gyi dbang gis skye'o snyam mo //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po stong pa 'di'i rgyu dang / rkyen gyi dbang gis skye'o snyam mo //
translated: This empty aggregate of formation arises through the power of causes and conditions.

original: yang dge slong de lus kyi reg bya'i tshor ba la rtog par byed de /
analyzed: yang dge slong de lus kyi reg bya'i tshor ba la rtog par byed de /
translated: “The monk also investigates the sensations of physical touch.

original: lus kyi tshor ba myong zhing rig pa 'di gang yin snyam mo //
analyzed: lus kyi tshor ba myong zhing rig pa 'di gang yin snyam mo //
translated: What is it that experiences and is aware of the sensations of the body?

original: de lus kyi tshor ba 'di yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang shin tu 'brel bar mthong ste /
analyzed: de lus kyi tshor ba 'di yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang shin tu 'brel bar mthong ste /
translated: He sees that the sensations of the body are closely related to the mental consciousness.

original: 'di la byed pa po dang / tshor ba po don gyi bar du gcod par 'gyur ba ni med de /
analyzed: 'di la byed pa po dang / tshor ba po don gyi bar du gcod par 'gyur ba ni med de /
translated: But there is no agent, no experiencer, and no obstruction to the object.

original: de 'du byed kyi phung po stong pa 'di rgyu dang / rkyen gyi dbang gi 'jug go snyam mo; ;yang dge slong de yid kyi tshor ba la rnam par rtog par byed de /
analyzed: de 'du byed kyi phung po stong pa 'di rgyu dang / rkyen gyi dbang gi 'jug go snyam mo; ;yang dge slong de yid kyi tshor ba la rnam par rtog par byed de /
translated: “The monk also contemplates mental feeling,

original: yid kyi tshor ba myong zhing rig pa 'di gang yin snyam mo //
analyzed: yid kyi tshor ba myong zhing rig pa 'di gang yin snyam mo //
translated: wondering, ‘What is the experience and awareness of mental feeling?’

original: de yid dang / chos la bsten nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye bar mthong ste /
analyzed: de yid dang / chos la bsten nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye bar mthong ste /
translated: He sees that mental consciousness arises in dependence on the mind and phenomena.
